##           梦想现实笔记DApp 项目白皮书 v1.0

### 1. 系统简介

梦想现实笔记DApp，完全去中心化的Web3.0社交媒体平台，用户发布的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频等等数据可以永久存储、永远存在。

### 2. 系统特性

* 用户发布的数据永久存储、永远存在。


* 完全去中心化的 Web3.0 社交媒体平台，由DAO治理，多链聚合。


* 结合社交功能的NFT创作与交易平台。


* 用户可以在本DApp系统发布任意长度的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频等等。


* 用户发布的以上类型的内容都自动成为一个一个互不相同的NFT。


* 本DApp系统拥有和微博、推特相似的社交功能，用户可以发布文章、发布回复、转发文章、创建个人资料、关注其他用户、点赞、打赏，等等。

### 3. 系统架构

![系统架构图](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SSqfuH7xr5McUSIo1nftn.png?height=502&width=865)

3\.1 内容数据永久存储层和NFT本身数据永久存储层

用户在本DApp系统发布的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频，其内容数据也就是NFT本身的数据，会以两种方式存储进入区块链的区块之中。方式一：数据直接存储进入Arweave区块链的区块之中；方式二：数据以区块链转账交易的备注的形式，存储进入ETH、EOS、BTC以及其它主流区块链公链的区块之中。以这两种方式存储到区块中的数据，都是不可修改、不可删除的，可以随着区块链的永存而永存。

本DApp系统支持用户将数据存储进入ETH、Arweave、EOS、BTC，以及其它主流区块链公链的区块之中。

由于这些内容数据是存储在区块链公链的区块之中，所以在内容数据存储层面实现了去中心化。

3\.2 目录索引永久存储层和NFT元数据永久存储层

用户在本DApp系统发布的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频，其目录数据和索引数据以及NFT的各项元数据，都存储在EOS公链的智能合约之中。

使用EOS智能合约的原因在于它拥有一个叫做“多索引表”的数据结构，可以像使用传统的关系型数据库一样对数据进行增删改查的操作，以及使用多个索引对数据进行查询。使用这项功能之后，可以不再使用中心化的数据库服务器存储和查询数据。

目前的各个主流区块链之中，只有EOS及其派生链比如Telos、WAX等拥有这个功能，其它的区块链都没有这个功能。因此为了不再使用中心化的数据库服务器，现在只能选择使用EOS公链或者其派生链。当未来有其他的公链也拥有这个功能的时候，我们也会支持这样的公链。

EOS智能合约未来会使用多签的形式进行权限管理，并且使用DAO的形式进行治理。因此EOS智能合约的管理权限会由一个DAO也即去中心化的自治组织掌握，不会由一个人或者一个私有组织掌握。

综上所述，本DApp系统没有使用中心化的数据库服务器对数据进行存储和查询。EOS智能合约也由DAO来治理。这两方面都实现了去中心化。

3\.3 Web前端服务层

本DApp系统的Web前端页面，是由静态的html和js文件，以及一些图片字体资源文件等等组成，全部文件都是静态文件。任何一个人都可以将本DApp系统的Web前端页面全部下载下来，放到自己搭建的Web服务器上，就可以正常运行。

目前本DApp系统的Web前端页面，就是直接放在 Netlify 这个专业的第三方静态Web页面托管商的服务器之上。本DApp系统的开发运营团队没有自己搭建并运行Web服务器。

当未来本DApp系统的功能全部开发完毕稳定运行之后，我们也会将Web前端页面搭建在基于IPFS或者Arweave等等第三方提供的Web前端环境之中。其他个人或者团队也可以按照他们的方式自行搭建本DApp系统的Web前端服务器。

因此，本DApp系统的Web前端服务，也是去中心化的。

3\.4 小结

经过上面的说明，可以看到，在本DApp系统的各个层面，没有使用任何一台依赖于开发运营团队的中心化的服务器。对需要进行治理的智能合约，也是采用DAO的形式进行治理。假设未来开发运营团队完全退出本项目，也不会影响本DApp系统的正常运行。

因此，我们可以看到，本DApp系统实现了完全的去中心化。

### 4. 用户激励和经济模型

本DApp系统会发行Token和NFT，用于用户激励和治理。项目的早期用户会得到丰厚的空投和更多份额的激励。

4\.1 普通文章

用户发布普通的文章，作者和读者都可以获得Token激励。作者在发布文章的时候得到激励。读者对文章进行点赞或者回复的时候得到激励。

4\.2 广告推广版块

在本DApp系统的首页会有一个广告推广版块，用户支付Token以后可以把自己发布的文章或者别的用户发布的文章加入到这个版块，在这个版块进行显示。读者点赞或者回复这个版块中的文章可以获得发布者支付的Token。Token被读者领取完毕之后，文章会从这个版块移除，不再显示。

4\.3 点赞、打赏

用户可以对优质的文章、回复、NFT作品进行点赞或者打赏的操作。打赏可以使用本DApp系统Token或者BTC、ETH、EOS、AR等等主流币种。这会给作者带来一定的收入。

4\.4 NFT交易平台

本DApp系统自带一个NFT交易平台，作者可以在此处销售自己的NFT作品，获得收入。

当一个NFT作品售出之后，该NFT作品以后收到的打赏或者再次出售的收益，或者未来其他的潜在收益，都归新主人所有。这为NFT作品的买家，提供了以后获取收益的机会。另外，NFT作品的每次交易，原创作者都会获得一定比例的分成。

4\.5 优质内容聚合功能

本DApp系统内置优质内容聚合功能，比如某个文章或者NFT作品的评论、回复数量达到一定数值，就可以进入精华区。这个功能有助于本DApp系统的新用户找到热点进行参与。同时，进入精华区的NFT作品，可能会产生较高的成交价格。有助于作者获得更高的收入，也有助于买家买到热门的作品。

### 5. 结合社交功能的NFT创作与交易平台

这是本DApp系统的NFT平台区别于其它NFT平台的特色功能之一。作者的原创NFT作品，包括各个种类的NFT作品，发布出来之后，都拥有评论的功能，作者可以与观众以评论、回复的形式进行互动交流，这些评论与回复也会成为NFT的一部分永久存在。作者可以解释作品的含义与意义，讲好作品的故事，得到观众的认同，由此产生的优秀作品和热门作品，易于以更高的价格成交。买家可以买到热门的优秀作品，以后随着作者的热度和知名度提高，这些作品的升值空间也会随之提高。

本DApp系统会收取一定比例的交易手续费。

### 6. DAO治理

本DApp系统对智能合约采用DAO的形式进行治理。用户在Token激励时获得的Token，同时也具备参与DAO治理投票的功能。另外，本DApp系统还会发行一款NFT，这款NFT也同时具有激励和治理的功能。达到一定条件的用户可以获得NFT的激励。

为了增加对DAO治理投票进行人为操纵的难度，本DApp系统的DAO治理采用双层表决制的方式，类似于议会的上议院与下议院，或者参议院与众议院。众议院使用Token投票，决定是否通过议案。参议院使用NFT投票，决定是否拒绝议案。在用户提出议案的时候，有两个投票表决的阶段。第一个阶段是众议院的Token投票，如果投票赞成的Token达到一定比例，那么议案获得初步通过，否则议案直接拒绝。如果议案初步通过，接着进入第二阶段，参议院的NFT投票，如果达到一定比例的NFT投票反对，那么议案会被最终拒绝，否则议案最终通过。

本DApp系统DAO治理的一个应用场景，可能就是当一个用户发布了带有争议的文章时，如果引起了其他用户的强烈反感，这部分用户可能会提出议案，要求删除该争议文章的目录和索引。在这种情况下，社区就可以使用上面的双层表决制进行投票表决。

本DApp系统的EOS智能合约本身，会使用多签的形式进行权限管理，将管理权限委托给21个超级节点。

### 7. 真实用户

为了防止有的不良用户使用大量虚假的机器人账户获取Token和NFT激励，本DApp系统会采用一个机制，识别出真人用户，并将真人用户的账户加入一个白名单。只有白名单中的用户，才可以得到Token和NFT激励。

### 8. 技术方面

8\.1 技术实现原理：如何将长数据存储到区块链的区块之中。

见链接：

<https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html?article=1>

8\.2 清晰的所有权，NFT作品的原创主人或者后续主人都拥有清晰的所有权。

用户使用本DApp系统的时候，需要在多个链上进行操作。在每个链上进行操作的时候，都需要用户使用自己的私钥，对交易或者操作进行签名。这样做保证了用户对自己的数据拥有无可争议的所有权。

当一个用户从另一个用户手里购买NFT作品的时候，所有的操作都是链上操作，在链上会留下所有的交易过程。这样NFT的新主人，也可以证明自己对NFT作品拥有无可争议的所有权。

8\.3 费用成本和操作门槛

用户使用本DApp系统的时候，需要自己支付将数据永久存储在区块链上的费用，有一定的费用成本。

用户还需要同时对几个区块链进行链上交易或者操作，需要一定的技能，有一定的技术门槛。因此，在一定的时期内，本系统比较适用于专业用户。

这种情况有利有弊。有弊之处在于，对新手用户不太友好。有利之处在于，由于用户需要付出费用成本，需要跨过一定的操作门槛，这样天然可以过滤掉一些滥发垃圾广告或者劣质内容的不良用户。对于社交媒体平台，应对这样的不良用户都是一件重要的事情。

### 9. 项目相关信息

9\.1 项目网址

<https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html>

9\.2 项目介绍和用户手册

<https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html?article=5>

### 10. 技术路线图

本DApp系统目前已经实现的主要功能有：
(1) 用户可以发布文章、回复、图片、视频、音频。
(2) 用户可以创建个人资料。
(3) 用户可以关注别的用户或者取消关注，查看关注用户发表的文章，等等。

下一步将要实现的主要功能如下（2022年第3季度和第4季度）：
(1) 发行激励Token和NFT。
(2) 实现对文章、回复进行点赞、打赏的功能。
(3) 实现NFT交易功能。

### 11. 团队介绍

创始人简介：Wingon Niu，前华为公有云/云存储业务高端5级技术顾问，拥有10年以上云计算与大数据方面的行业经验。拥有丰富的区块链方面的开发经验，熟悉ETH、EOS智能合约以及Web前端的开发、部署、运营。

目前本DApp系统的Web前端页面，就是直接放在 Netlify 这个专业的第三方静态Web页面托管商的服务器之上。本DApp系统的开发运营团队没有自己搭建并运行Web服务器。

当未来本DApp系统的功能全部开发完毕稳定运行之后，我们也会将Web前端页面搭建在基于IPFS或者Arweave等等第三方提供的Web前端环境之中。其他个人或者团队也可以按照他们的方式自行搭建本DApp系统的Web前端服务器。

因此，本DApp系统的Web前端服务，也是去中心化的。

3\.4 小结

经过上面的说明，可以看到，在本DApp系统的各个层面，没有使用任何一台依赖于开发运营团队的中心化的服务器。对需要进行治理的智能合约，也是采用DAO的形式进行治理。假设未来开发运营团队完全退出本项目，也不会影响本DApp系统的正常运行。

因此，我们可以看到，本DApp系统实现了完全的去中心化。

### 4. 用户激励和经济模型

本DApp系统会发行Token和NFT，用于用户激励和治理。项目的早期用户会得到丰厚的空投和更多份额的激励。

4\.1 普通文章

用户发布普通的文章，作者和读者都可以获得Token激励。作者在发布文章的时候得到激励。读者对文章进行点赞或者回复的时候得到激励。

4\.2 广告推广版块

在本DApp系统的首页会有一个广告推广版块，用户支付Token以后可以把自己发布的文章或者别的用户发布的文章加入到这个版块，在这个版块进行显示。读者点赞或者回复这个版块中的文章可以获得发布者支付的Token。Token被读者领取完毕之后，文章会从这个版块移除，不再显示。

4\.3 点赞、打赏

用户可以对优质的文章、回复、NFT作品进行点赞或者打赏的操作。打赏可以使用本DApp系统Token或者BTC、ETH、EOS、AR等等主流币种。这会给作者带来一定的收入。

4\.4 NFT交易平台

本DApp系统自带一个NFT交易平台，作者可以在此处销售自己的NFT作品，获得收入。

当一个NFT作品售出之后，该NFT作品以后收到的打赏或者再次出售的收益，或者未来其他的潜在收益，都归新主人所有。这为NFT作品的买家，提供了以后获取收益的机会。另外，NFT作品的每次交易，原创作者都会获得一定比例的分成。

4\.5 优质内容聚合功能

本DApp系统内置优质内容聚合功能，比如某个文章或者NFT作品的评论、回复数量达到一定数值，就可以进入精华区。这个功能有助于本DApp系统的新用户找到热点进行参与。同时，进入精华区的NFT作品，可能会产生较高的成交价格。有助于作者获得更高的收入，也有助于买家买到热门的作品。

### 5. 结合社交功能的NFT创作与交易平台

这是本DApp系统的NFT平台区别于其它NFT平台的特色功能之一。作者的原创NFT作品，包括各个种类的NFT作品，发布出来之后，都拥有评论的功能，作者可以与观众以评论、回复的形式进行互动交流，这些评论与回复也会成为NFT的一部分永久存在。作者可以解释作品的含义与意义，讲好作品的故事，得到观众的认同，由此产生的优秀作品和热门作品，易于以更高的价格成交。买家可以买到热门的优秀作品，以后随着作者的热度和知名度提高，这些作品的升值空间也会随之提高。

本DApp系统会收取一定比例的交易手续费。

### 6. DAO治理

本DApp系统对智能合约采用DAO的形式进行治理。用户在Token激励时获得的Token，同时也具备参与DAO治理投票的功能。另外，本DApp系统还会发行一款NFT，这款NFT也同时具有激励和治理的功能。达到一定条件的用户可以获得NFT的激励。

为了增加对DAO治理投票进行人为操纵的难度，本DApp系统的DAO治理采用双层表决制的方式，类似于议会的上议院与下议院，或者参议院与众议院。众议院使用Token投票，决定是否通过议案。参议院使用NFT投票，决定是否拒绝议案。在用户提出议案的时候，有两个投票表决的阶段。第一个阶段是众议院的Token投票，如果投票赞成的Token达到一定比例，那么议案获得初步通过，否则议案直接拒绝。如果议案初步通过，接着进入第二阶段，参议院的NFT投票，如果达到一定比例的NFT投票反对，那么议案会被最终拒绝，否则议案最终通过。

本DApp系统DAO治理的一个应用场景，可能就是当一个用户发布了带有争议的文章时，如果引起了其他用户的强烈反感，这部分用户可能会提出议案，要求删除该争议文章的目录和索引。在这种情况下，社区就可以使用上面的双层表决制进行投票表决。

本DApp系统的EOS智能合约本身，会使用多签的形式进行权限管理，将管理权限委托给21个超级节点。

### 7. 真实用户

为了防止有的不良用户使用大量虚假的机器人账户获取Token和NFT激励，本DApp系统会采用一个机制，识别出真人用户，并将真人用户的账户加入一个白名单。只有白名单中的用户，才可以得到Token和NFT激励。

### 8. 技术方面

8\.1 技术实现原理：如何将长数据存储到区块链的区块之中。

见链接：

<https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html?article=1>

8\.2 清晰的所有权，NFT作品的原创主人或者后续主人都拥有清晰的所有权。

用户使用本DApp系统的时候，需要在多个链上进行操作。在每个链上进行操作的时候，都需要用户使用自己的私钥，对交易或者操作进行签名。这样做保证了用户对自己的数据拥有无可争议的所有权。

当一个用户从另一个用户手里购买NFT作品的时候，所有的操作都是链上操作，在链上会留下所有的交易过程。这样NFT的新主人，也可以证明自己对NFT作品拥有无可争议的所有权。

8\.3 费用成本和操作门槛

用户使用本DApp系统的时候，需要自己支付将数据永久存储在区块链上的费用，有一定的费用成本。

用户还需要同时对几个区块链进行链上交易或者操作，需要一定的技能，有一定的技术门槛。因此，在一定的时期内，本系统比较适用于专业用户。

这种情况有利有弊。有弊之处在于，对新手用户不太友好。有利之处在于，由于用户需要付出费用成本，需要跨过一定的操作门槛，这样天然可以过滤掉一些滥发垃圾广告或者劣质内容的不良用户。对于社交媒体平台，应对这样的不良用户都是一件重要的事情。

title: The Social Layer and Crypto
body:
**\*NOTE:** This is a post I made a while back. Posting it here so it can be read across different platforms. Check out my substack [here](https://merkle.substack.com) to read other writings. 

## How did we get here?

### The rise of the internet

 
 The rise of the internet has brought about a digital revolution of information sharing, connecting people from all over the world. This influx of data consumption has caused humans to become more involved with online platforms as a means of communication, and to remain connected with the rest of the world.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cJQv-juN5kt8crTajTaq3.png?height=481&width=640)

### The Social Layer

The pressure to stay connected with the rest of the world has driven the social layer of our society from the physical world to the digital world over the past two decades. Being in an online society comes with many challenges such as verifying information to be credible, as well as being exposed to more people at such a scale that we humans had not evolved to encounter in our lifetime. How do we counter these issues? The answer is crypto technologies, which can enable us to better navigate the online world.

### What is Identity and Why is it Important?

Let’s first start with a basic idea of what identity is. Identity is a collection of claims about someone or something. Identity can consist of several data points that allow us to differentiate between each other and other things. In the case of people, this could be a passport, driver's license, social security number, etc. These data points allow us to cross-reference and verify one’s identity.

Identity is valuable to us as a society for a variety of reasons. It allows us to verify people are who they say they are for important operations such as voting or traveling to other countries. It also attaches a source to information that is spread out to others. In a world where the spread of information and the amount of information is rapidly increasing, identity becomes even more valuable as a way to verify credible sources.

### How can Blockchain improve identity?

Blockchains are open distributed ledgers that allow for online identities to have unique, inherent properties.

The first is, accessibility to identity. Around [1.1 billion people around the world have no proof of identity](https://id4d.worldbank.org/global-dataset), and 45% of those without an identity are among the poorest 20% on the planet.[\[1\]](https://consensys.net/blockchain-use-cases/digital-identity/#howidentityworks) Identification processes can be cumbersome, expensive, and even too confusing for many people who are not familiar with the process. All of these aspects of the current identification processes are roadblocks to greater participation in a global community.

A second major problem is data security. Currently, a majority of valuable identification information is stored on centralized databases propped up by legacy software operating with many single points of failure. Being able to decentralize this data would mean more resilience to people’s identities on the internet.

A third issue is a fraudulent identity. Users’ digital identity is exceptionally fragmented across different platforms. There is no standard way to use the data for it to be used by all platforms homogeneously. Moreover, the weak link between digital and offline identities makes it relatively easy to create fake identities. False identities allow for the propagation of false information. Being able to verify this with blockchain and crypto technologies would bring society closer to a world with decentralized information with verifiable sources.

### Application of Crypto Technologies to the Social Layer

With the influx of information available, it is difficult to sift through what is credible information and what is not. I believe that crypto can help us as a society address these challenges through various means.

The first challenge that crypto can address is that of verifying internet identities. The issues that must be addressed with verifying internet identity include: how do we verify an account is an actual person and how can we discern which of these identities is more credible than others. One possible solution is to have users connect their crypto wallets to all platforms they use. By doing this we could have a consistent single account with which we could track its interactions and activity with other accounts on various platforms.

Linking a person’s wallet would not only allow us to track their activity in order to identify certain patterns, but it also means we could incorporate economic incentives into online social platforms that keep them from being malicious actors. We could have social media that require accounts to hold a certain amount of tokens to be able to interact with the platform and protocol. These tokens could be slashed for any malicious behavior that is done. Moreover, adding community governance would allow for moderation in a more decentralized and robust way.

A second use case for crypto technologies is already being explored in its nascent form: using tokens as a filter for communities. Community curation can be seen in various forms though I will use the example of DAOs (Decentralized Autonomous Organizations) and NFT art communities. When joining one of these communities, it is common to find yourself in their community discord server. When one joins a server, they expect to be prompted by a server bot asking them to verify that they are either holding a certain amount of governance tokens in the DAO’s case or if they are holding a certain NFT art piece from a collection in the Art community’s case. If one does not hold the required token or cannot prove it, they do not have access to the entire server and all of the channels it contains. This is an early form of what will become a major movement looking forward. These are communities that select community members by seeing who has “skin in the game”. This is an attempt to ensure that every member of the community has a base level of commonality, which is critical for social cohesion. Without a foundation of some similarity, large, distributed groups cannot reliably coordinate or trust each other.

These are just some thoughts I’ve had so far and this is not an exhaustive list. I plan to continue to add to these over time in order to track my thoughts.

title: Finally Understanding the Data Availability
body:
## Introduction

### Why I started to learn Data Availability

If I have to choose the 3 most important topics in blockchain technology, It would be Interoperability, Data Availability and Scalability. Although these topics are all interesting, I dived in to data availability because of the **Celestia**. As many of smart people started to tweet about Celestia, I tried to learn about it. However, I failed because I had no clue what Data Availability was. It was then that my journey to Data Availability began.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/c6d87efc-7530-4008-a757-e8a8ee99f7cd/Untitled.png)

### Definition of Data Availability

Data Availability refers to whether the entire data of newly produced block is available to nodes.

### Why does it matters

Then why does Data Availability matters? It’s because proper fraud proof can be done only when Data Availability is guaranteed.


---

## Fraud Proof

### Full node and Light node

There’s two type of nodes in blockchain. **Full node** downloads all the data in blockchain and verifies the validity of transaction itself. Therefore, there are certain requirement of hardware and storage to operate full node. However, as every node cannot satisfy these requirements, **light nodes** exists. Light nodes only downloads the block header, so they **rely on full node for transaction verification**.

At this point, how will light nodes detect whether new block contains invalid transaction?

If full node detect invalid transactions while verifying newly created block, it sends something called **fraud proof** to light node. Light node verifies this fraud proof and if it’s valid, it judges that current block contains invalid transaction and rejects the block.

**When full node submits fraud proof of certain transaction, it needs the data of corresponding transaction.**

### Situation when Fraud Proof may not work

Fraud proof may fail in following situation.

**Malicious block producer can hide and not publish certain data which contains the invalid transaction. Furthermore, he might only publish block header.**

Now, as light nodes only download block header, it cannot know if invalid transaction is contained or not. Full nodes, because it downloads the entire data, it can detect the invalid transaction. However, it cannot submit the corresponding fraud proof to light node because the invalid transaction data is not published by block producer. So, because fraud proof is not submitted, light nodes may think that block is valid and invalid transaction will be contained in the blockchain.

Additionally, when fraction of data is not published to nodes, we cannot determine whether it’s intentional by block publisher or it’s due to systemic error like network delay. So. we get caught in dilemma where neither we can punish the block producer nor just leave it alone.

We call this situation as **Data Availability Problem**.


---

## Data Availability Problem

Data Availability can be defined as following.

* How can we be sure that every data of newly produced block is published to nodes?

or

* How can we enforce block producer to publish all the data of newly produced block?

### Wrong Solution

Simple, but wrong solution is to enforce all the light nodes to download the entire blockchain data. It would solve the problem, but It goes against the purpose of the light node in the first place.

### Data Availability Proof

This is the answer that we are looking for. Data Availability Proof enables light nodes to only download some pieces of block data to verify whether entire block data is published to nodes.


---

## Data Availability Proof

### Erasure Coding

Erasure coding is mathematical scheme used in Data Availability Proof. **The goal of erasure coding is although part of data is erased(lost), we can recover the original data with remaining ones.** The most well-known erasure coding technique is the **Reed-Solomon code**.

* Mechanism

We transform original length k data into length n. With subset of n chunks of data, we can recover the original data.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/99b5a8ff-8ada-4c1e-b09f-9a80ed382000/Untitled.png)

* Simplest example of erasure coding

This is the special case when n = k+1. For example, let’s say that original data is “2 3 5 8” which is length 4. We transform this data into length 5 by adding the sum of original data, 18. At last, data becomes “2 3 5 8 18”.

After that, let’s say that we lost the second data, so data becomes “2 ? 5 8 18”. As we know that the last number is the sum of previous data, we can easily calculate that 3 is the missing data, which we just recovered the original data.

* Slightly harder example of erasure coding

This is the special case when k = 2. For example, let’s say that original data is “2 3” which is length 2(k = 2). In this case, we can make a linear function f(x) that satisfies f(0)=2 and f(1)=3, where f(x)=x+2. We transform this data into length 4 by adding f(2), f(3) which is 4, 5. At last, data becomes “2 3 4 5”.

After that, let’s say that we lost the first and second data, so data becomes “? ? 4 5”. As we know the f(x), we can calculate the f(0) and f(1) to recover the original data.

* Erasure coding in Data Availability Proof

For convenience, let’s assume that n = 2k. We first divide entire transaction data of block into k data chunks. Then, by erasure coding, we transform the original data into n data chunks. Merkle Root of these n data chunks are included in block header.

Because n = 2k, We only need at least k data chunks, which is 50% of data to recover the original data. **This means that in order to prevent a malicious block producer from recovering the entire block, at least k+1 chunks, about 50% or more of data, should be hidden and not propagated.**

### Mechanism

Let’s say that block data is erasure coded and original data of length k transformed into data of length 2k. So, to recover the full block, nodes only need at least k data chunks. At this point, for malicious block producer to include specific invalid transaction inside the newly created block, he should hide at least k+1 data chunks. How will light nodes detect that this block is invalid without downloading full data? It works as follows.

First, light nodes randomly download some data chunk and if corresponding chunk is unavailable because malicious block producer has not published, light node judges that block is invalid and reject it. If the node download one data chunk every round, the odd that light node will detect the invalid block at first round will be 50%. With second rounds, odd becomes 75%, third rounds 87.5%, and eventually with 15 rounds the odd converges to 100%.

### One last question

So we have learned how light nodes verify data availability without relying on full node and downloading the full data. However, there is still one problem left that we haven’t cover. How can we be sure that block data is erasure coded correctly? If, malicious block producer doesn’t implement erasure coding correctly, Data Availability Proof wouldn’t work.

Because full node downloads all the data, it can verify the validity of erasure coding by comparing the given erasure coded data and data that node erasure coded by itself. However, problem occurs for the light nodes because light nodes doesn’t download full data.

In conclusion, we can use multi-dimensional Reed-Solomon code to check the validity of erasure coding only with partial data. Although the detailed mechanism of Reed-Solomon code is beyond the scope of this article, long story short, 2D Reed-Solom code transforms the original data into 2-dimensional matrix.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/32e9da5f-07b7-4d42-8553-632efd04d210/Untitled.png)

When we represent data into 2-dimensional, when the original data is length of k, each edge becomes length k^(1/2). So, to check if specific row or column is erasure coded correctly, we only need k^(1/2), not k.

From the point of complexity, original 1D Reed-Solomon code has O(n) time and storage complexity, but 2D Reed-Solomon code has O(n^(1/2)) when original data is length of n. However, multi dimensional Reed-Solomon code makes the entire erasure coded data much bigger.


---

## Moreover,

If you got interested in Data Availability problem and curious about enormous details which is missing in this article, I strongly recommend you to check out following contents.

* [Original paper by Vitalik Buterin](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1809.09044.pdf)

  Because this paper is the basis of Data Availability Problem, you can learn the A to Z of Data Availability from this paper. However, because its legit research paper, it’s long and complicated(at least for me).
* [1 to 1 lecture video based on above paper](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jM-om3AqH94)

  This lecture is John Adler, CRO of Celestia explaining about Data Availability Problem to Alexander Skidanov, Co-founder of NEAR protocol. I recommend this video because it covers almost the same content as the above paper, but explains it with an easier example.
* If you want to know more about Erasure Coding & Reed-Solomon code

  While I dig into Data Availability Problem, erasure coding and Reed-Solomon code was the hardest part to understand.

  Learning about Parity check is the easiest way to understand erasure coding. [This video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pUBdJi6eVYA) teaches Partiy check very easily. After, you may check [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxyqvB6bZs4) and [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RFOGDY2e0mQ), also. If you got the big picture of erasure coding, check out the [wikepedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erasure_code) because it gives two examples about erasure coding.

  If you want to know exactly what Reed-Solomon code is, I recommend [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yQkEnde2lNg) which I’m also studying.
* Articles that I referred to
  * [WTF is Data Availability](https://medium.com/blockchain-capital-blog/wtf-is-data-availability-80c2c95ded0f)
  * [What Is Data Availability?](https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/article/what-is-data-availability)
  * [Data availability checks](https://dankradfeist.de/ethereum/2019/12/20/data-availability-checks.html)
  * [The Data Availability Problem](https://blog.polygon.technology/the-data-availability-problem-6b74b619ffcc/)

Fraud proof may fail in following situation.

**Malicious block producer can hide and not publish certain data which contains the invalid transaction. Furthermore, he might only publish block header.**

Now, as light nodes only download block header, it cannot know if invalid transaction is contained or not. Full nodes, because it downloads the entire data, it can detect the invalid transaction. However, it cannot submit the corresponding fraud proof to light node because the invalid transaction data is not published by block producer. So, because fraud proof is not submitted, light nodes may think that block is valid and invalid transaction will be contained in the blockchain.

Additionally, when fraction of data is not published to nodes, we cannot determine whether it’s intentional by block publisher or it’s due to systemic error like network delay. So. we get caught in dilemma where neither we can punish the block producer nor just leave it alone.

We call this situation as **Data Availability Problem**.


---

## Data Availability Problem

Data Availability can be defined as following.

* How can we be sure that every data of newly produced block is published to nodes?

or

* How can we enforce block producer to publish all the data of newly produced block?

### Wrong Solution

Simple, but wrong solution is to enforce all the light nodes to download the entire blockchain data. It would solve the problem, but It goes against the purpose of the light node in the first place.

### Data Availability Proof

This is the answer that we are looking for. Data Availability Proof enables light nodes to only download some pieces of block data to verify whether entire block data is published to nodes.


---

## Data Availability Proof

### Erasure Coding

Erasure coding is mathematical scheme used in Data Availability Proof. **The goal of erasure coding is although part of data is erased(lost), we can recover the original data with remaining ones.** The most well-known erasure coding technique is the **Reed-Solomon code**.

* Mechanism

We transform original length k data into length n. With subset of n chunks of data, we can recover the original data.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/99b5a8ff-8ada-4c1e-b09f-9a80ed382000/Untitled.png)

* Simplest example of erasure coding

This is the special case when n = k+1. For example, let’s say that original data is “2 3 5 8” which is length 4. We transform this data into length 5 by adding the sum of original data, 18. At last, data becomes “2 3 5 8 18”.

After that, let’s say that we lost the second data, so data becomes “2 ? 5 8 18”. As we know that the last number is the sum of previous data, we can easily calculate that 3 is the missing data, which we just recovered the original data.

* Slightly harder example of erasure coding

This is the special case when k = 2. For example, let’s say that original data is “2 3” which is length 2(k = 2). In this case, we can make a linear function f(x) that satisfies f(0)=2 and f(1)=3, where f(x)=x+2. We transform this data into length 4 by adding f(2), f(3) which is 4, 5. At last, data becomes “2 3 4 5”.

After that, let’s say that we lost the first and second data, so data becomes “? ? 4 5”. As we know the f(x), we can calculate the f(0) and f(1) to recover the original data.

* Erasure coding in Data Availability Proof

For convenience, let’s assume that n = 2k. We first divide entire transaction data of block into k data chunks. Then, by erasure coding, we transform the original data into n data chunks. Merkle Root of these n data chunks are included in block header.

Because n = 2k, We only need at least k data chunks, which is 50% of data to recover the original data. **This means that in order to prevent a malicious block producer from recovering the entire block, at least k+1 chunks, about 50% or more of data, should be hidden and not propagated.**

### Mechanism

Let’s say that block data is erasure coded and original data of length k transformed into data of length 2k. So, to recover the full block, nodes only need at least k data chunks. At this point, for malicious block producer to include specific invalid transaction inside the newly created block, he should hide at least k+1 data chunks. How will light nodes detect that this block is invalid without downloading full data? It works as follows.

First, light nodes randomly download some data chunk and if corresponding chunk is unavailable because malicious block producer has not published, light node judges that block is invalid and reject it. If the node download one data chunk every round, the odd that light node will detect the invalid block at first round will be 50%. With second rounds, odd becomes 75%, third rounds 87.5%, and eventually with 15 rounds the odd converges to 100%.

### One last question

So we have learned how light nodes verify data availability without relying on full node and downloading the full data. However, there is still one problem left that we haven’t cover. How can we be sure that block data is erasure coded correctly? If, malicious block producer doesn’t implement erasure coding correctly, Data Availability Proof wouldn’t work.

Because full node downloads all the data, it can verify the validity of erasure coding by comparing the given erasure coded data and data that node erasure coded by itself. However, problem occurs for the light nodes because light nodes doesn’t download full data.

In conclusion, we can use multi-dimensional Reed-Solomon code to check the validity of erasure coding only with partial data. Although the detailed mechanism of Reed-Solomon code is beyond the scope of this article, long story short, 2D Reed-Solom code transforms the original data into 2-dimensional matrix.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/32e9da5f-07b7-4d42-8553-632efd04d210/Untitled.png)

When we represent data into 2-dimensional, when the original data is length of k, each edge becomes length k^(1/2). So, to check if specific row or column is erasure coded correctly, we only need k^(1/2), not k.

From the point of complexity, original 1D Reed-Solomon code has O(n) time and storage complexity, but 2D Reed-Solomon code has O(n^(1/2)) when original data is length of n. However, multi dimensional Reed-Solomon code makes the entire erasure coded data much bigger.


---

## Moreover,

If you got interested in Data Availability problem and curious about enormous details which is missing in this article, I strongly recommend you to check out following contents.

* [Original paper by Vitalik Buterin](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1809.09044.pdf)

  Because this paper is the basis of Data Availability Problem, you can learn the A to Z of Data Availability from this paper. However, because its legit research paper, it’s long and complicated(at least for me).
* [1 to 1 lecture video based on above paper](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jM-om3AqH94)

  This lecture is John Adler, CRO of Celestia explaining about Data Availability Problem to Alexander Skidanov, Co-founder of NEAR protocol. I recommend this video because it covers almost the same content as the above paper, but explains it with an easier example.
* If you want to know more about Erasure Coding & Reed-Solomon code

  While I dig into Data Availability Problem, erasure coding and Reed-Solomon code was the hardest part to understand.

  Learning about Parity check is the easiest way to understand erasure coding. [This video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pUBdJi6eVYA) teaches Partiy check very easily. After, you may check [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxyqvB6bZs4) and [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RFOGDY2e0mQ), also. If you got the big picture of erasure coding, check out the [wikepedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erasure_code) because it gives two examples about erasure coding.

  If you want to know exactly what Reed-Solomon code is, I recommend [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yQkEnde2lNg) which I’m also studying.
* Articles that I referred to
  * [WTF is Data Availability](https://medium.com/blockchain-capital-blog/wtf-is-data-availability-80c2c95ded0f)
  * [What Is Data Availability?](https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/article/what-is-data-availability)
  * [Data availability checks](https://dankradfeist.de/ethereum/2019/12/20/data-availability-checks.html)
  * [The Data Availability Problem](https://blog.polygon.technology/the-data-availability-problem-6b74b619ffcc/)

### A. Project Introduction

The DreamRealNotes DApp, web3.0 social application, the content of articles published by users can be permanently stored in the blocks of the blockchain, and users can record reality and dreams.

This DApp system has social functions similar to Twitter. Users can post articles, reply to, forward articles, create personal profile, follow other users, and so on. Articles published by users can also be understood as different NFTs.

Brief summary:

The social function of Twitter + the permanent storage function of articles in Mirror = This DApp

DApp website:     https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html

At present, this DApp system has realized that the content of articles of any length can be stored in the blocks of the ETH public chain. The catalog data of the article is stored in the smart contract of the EOS public chain.

Therefore, at present, the DApp system needs to jointly use the ETH public chain and the EOS public chain. The block of the ETH public chain is responsible for storing the article content, and the smart contract of the EOS public chain is responsible for storing the article catalog.

Using the mobile wallet App to access this DApp system, you can only browse and view articles, and cannot perform other operations. Because existing mobile wallet Apps cannot operate on two blockchains at the same time.

In order to use the full functionality of this DApp system, it is recommended to use a Personal Computer, Google Chrome, Scatter, MetaMask.

In the coming months, the following features will be implemented:

1\. Added support for Arweave, users can choose to store articles or pictures in the Arweave blockchain.

2\. Realize the functions of liking and rewarding articles and replies.

3\. Issue NFTs to users of this DApp system.

### A. 项目介绍

梦想现实笔记DApp，Web3.0社交应用，用户发布的文章内容可以永久存储在区块链的区块之中，用户可以记录现实和梦想。

本DApp系统拥有和微博推特相似的社交功能，用户可以发布文章、回复、转发文章、创建个人资料、关注其他用户等等。

用户发布的文章也可以理解为一个一个互不相同的NFT。

简要概括：

微博推特的社交功能 + Mirror的文章永久存储功能 = 本DApp

项目网址：        https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html

本DApp系统目前已经实现了将任意长度的文章内容存储在ETH公链的区块之中。文章的目录数据存储在EOS公链的智能合约之中。

因此目前的本DApp系统需要同时联合使用ETH公链和EOS公链，ETH公链的区块负责存储文章内容，EOS公链的智能合约负责存储文章目录。

使用手机钱包App访问本DApp系统，只能浏览、查看文章，不能进行其他操作。因为现有的手机钱包App不可以同时在两个区块链上进行操作。

为了使用本DApp系统的完整功能，建议使用个人电脑，谷歌浏览器，Scatter，MetaMask。

在未来的几个月，将实现以下功能：

1\. 增加对Arweave的支持，用户可以选择将文章或者图片存储进Arweave区块链。

2\. 实现对文章、回复进行点赞、打赏的功能。

3\. 为本DApp系统的用户发行NFT。

### B. User Manual

### B. 用户手册

1\. Visit the DreamRealNotes DApp, open the link: https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html, enter the home page, as shown in the figure below:

1\. 访问梦想现实笔记DApp，打开链接：https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html ，进入首页，如下图所示：

![(Img A)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aSbhJsvazEOkyy-S6LDyD.png?height=332&width=1339)

4\. Click the small icon in the upper right corner of the home page, a pop-up menu will appear, click "ETH Connect MetaMask" in it, as shown in the figure below, and then confirm the connection with this DApp in MetaMask.

4\. 点击首页右上角的小图标，出现弹出菜单，点击里面的“ETH连接MetaMask”，如下图，然后在MetaMask中确认与本DApp进行连接。

5\. Click the "Write an article" button in the lower left corner of the home page, and the following window will appear:

5\. 点击首页左下角的“写文章”按钮，出现如下窗口：

![(Img E)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VkqggC2x-GqlueFz9SLRI.png?height=595&width=541)

6\. In this window, select the article type, category, storage location, and fill in the article title and article content. Currently the storage location only supports ETH. When sending an ETH transfer transaction in the following steps, it is to transfer to the ETH account of the development team, and each transfer is 0.0005ETH (fixed value, cannot be modified, and may be adjusted in the future).

6\. 在本窗口中选择文章类型、类别、存储位置，填写文章标题、文章内容。目前存储位置只支持ETH。在后面的步骤中发送ETH转账交易时，是向开发团队的ETH账号进行转账，每次转账0.0005ETH（固定值，不可修改，未来可能会调整）。

7\. 点击本窗口中的“查看交易次数”按钮，出现提示窗口：

![(Img F)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IqCsUWJPhvi-iJH7ouKRr.png?height=165&width=449)

8\. The prompt in the above figure means that a total of 2 transactions need to be sent, the first one is an ETH transfer transaction, and the last one is an EOS on-chain transaction. If the displayed number is 3, it means that the first two transactions are ETH transfer transactions, and the last one is an EOS on-chain transaction. If the displayed number is 10, it means that the first 9 transactions are ETH transfer transactions, and the last one is an EOS on-chain transaction. The larger the length of the article, the higher this number will be. The current setting is that each ETH transfer transaction can send up to 3336 characters. The entire article will be automatically split into multiple parts according to this length, and each transfer transaction sends one of these parts.

8\. 上图的提示意思是总共需要发送2次交易，前面1次是ETH转账交易，最后1次是EOS上链交易。如果显示的数字是3，则表示前面2次是ETH转账交易，最后1次是EOS上链交易。如果显示的数字是10，则表示前面9次是ETH转账交易，最后1次是EOS上链交易。文章的长度越大，这个数字就越大。目前的设置是每次ETH转账交易最多可以发送3336个汉字。整篇文章会自动按照这个长度拆分成多个部分，每个转账交易发送其中的一个部分。

9\. Click the "Post" button in the window in step 5 to start sending the article, and the MetaMask trading interface will pop up, as shown below:

9\. 在第5步的弹出窗口中点击“发送”按钮，开始进行文章发送，会弹出MetaMask交易界面，如下图：

12\. If the article is long and you need to send multiple ETH transfer transactions, the DApp will automatically pop up the interface for each ETH transfer transaction, just follow the above method to send the transaction.

17\. If there is a transaction failure error message during the process of sending the transaction, such as insufficient ETH balance, insufficient EOS CPU resources, etc., do not refresh the DApp page at this time, but use another wallet or tool to solve the error in the error prompt. Once the error is solved, then click the "Resume from break point" button on the DApp page to continue sending the transaction from the place where the error occurred.

17\. 如果在发送交易的过程中出现交易失败的错误提示，比如ETH余额不足、EOS的CPU资源不足等等，此时不要刷新DApp页面，而是使用别的钱包或者工具，将错误提示中的错误解决掉，然后点击DApp页面中的“断点续传”按钮，就可以从发生错误的地方继续进行交易的发送。

18\. After all transactions are successfully sent, wait for a few minutes, click another Tab page at the top of the DApp home page, and then click back, which can refresh the list of articles in the Real Notes and Dream Notes. 18\. 所有交易成功发送完毕后，稍等几分钟，在DApp首页点击顶部的另一个Tab页，然后再点击回来，这样可以刷新现实笔记和梦想笔记中的文章列表。在对应的Tab页中就可以看到刚才发布的新文章了。如下图：

19\. You can go to the ETH blockchain browser to verify whether the content of the article is stored in ETH. Click the article id above the article preview in the image above, and a prompt box will pop up, as shown below:

19\. 可以到ETH区块链浏览器验证一下文章内容是否存储到ETH上了。点击上图中文章预览上方的文章id，弹出提示框，如下图：

20\. Double-click the long hash string displayed in the above prompt box with the mouse to select the hash string and copy it to the clipboard. Note that there may be a bug in Google Chrome. Sometimes when you double-click the hash string with the mouse, it shows that the hash string is not completely selected, only a part of it is selected, and some letters are not selected. If this is the case, ignore it, the hash string has been completely and correctly selected.

20\. 在上面的提示框中用鼠标双击显示的长长的hash字符串，就可以选中这个hash字符串，然后复制到剪贴板。注意，这里可能有个谷歌浏览器的bug，有时候用鼠标双击hash字符串的时候，显示出hash字符串没有被完全选中，只选中了一部分，有几个字母没有被选中。如果遇到这种情况，不用理会，hash字符串已经被完全并且正确选中了。

21\. Visit the ETH blockchain browser, the link is: https://etherscan.io, paste the hash string copied in the previous step into the search box, search, and the following page appears:

22\. In the Input Data section at the bottom of the page, select "View As UTF8" to see the content of the article. Repeat this process until you find one starting with {}, then this is the last part of the article.

22\. 在页面底部的Input Data部分，选择“View As UTF8”，就可以看到文章的内容。如果开头的{}中含有一个hash字符串，则继续搜索这个hash字符串，将会搜索到文章的下一部分。重复这个过程，直到搜索到一个以{}开头的，那么这个就是文章的最后一部分。

23\. In the Gas Limit & Usage by Txn section, you can see the actual amount of Gas consumed by the transaction, which is only about 25% of the estimated amount in article "Must Read and Agreement for Community Users".

23\. 在Gas Limit & Usage by Txn部分，可以看到交易实际消耗的Gas数量，只有“社区用户必读和用户协议”这篇文章中估算的25%左右。

24\. At this point, the verification is completed, and the content of the article has indeed been stored in the ETH block.

24\. 到此，验证完毕，文章内容确实被存储进了ETH的区块之中。

25\. If the user chooses another storage location when sending the article, the operation process is basically the same.

25\. 如果用户在发送文章时选择的是其它的存储位置，操作过程基本上是一样的。

body:
## DreamRealNotes DApp Project White Paper v1.0

### 1. System Introduction

DreamRealNotes DApp, a completely decentralized Web3.0 social media platform, the articles, replies, pictures, videos, audios and other data published by users can be permanently stored and exist forever.

### 2. System Features

* The data published by the user is permanently stored and exists forever.


* A fully decentralized Web3.0 social media platform, governed by DAO, multi-chain aggregation.


* An NFT creation and trading platform that combines social functions.


* Users can publish articles, replies, pictures, videos, audios, etc. of any length in this DApp system.


* The above types of content posted by users automatically become a different NFT.


* This DApp system has social functions similar to Twitter. Users can post articles, post replies, forward articles, create personal profiles, follow other users, like, give rewards, and so on.

### 3. System Architecture

![System Architecture Diagram](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V2dBfj-j-5sY3WOO-v0ZA.png?height=502&width=865)

3\.1 Content data permanent storage layer and NFT own data permanent storage layer

Articles, replies, pictures, videos, and audios published by users in this DApp system, the content data of which is the data of the NFT itself, will be stored in the blocks of the public blockchain in two ways. Method 1: The data is directly stored in the blocks of the Arweave blockchain. Method 2: The data is stored in the blocks of ETH, EOS, BTC and other mainstream public blockchains in the form of remarks of blockchain transfer transactions among. The data stored in the block in these two ways is unmodifiable and undeletable, and can be perpetuated with the perpetuity of the public blockchain.

This DApp system supports users to store data into the blocks of ETH, Arweave, EOS, BTC, and other mainstream public blockchains.

Since these content data are stored in the blocks of the public blockchain, decentralization is achieved at the content data storage level.

3\.2 Catalog/Indexes Permanent Storage Layer and NFT Metadata Permanent Storage Layer

Articles, replies, pictures, videos, and audios published by users in this DApp system, their catalog data and index data, and metadata of NFT are stored in the smart contracts of the EOS public blockchain.

The reason for using EOS smart contract is that it has a data structure called "multi index table", which can add, delete, modify and query data like traditional relational databases, and use multiple indexes to query data. After using this function, the centralized database server can no longer be used to store and query data.

Among the current mainstream public blockchains, only EOS and its derivative chains such as Telos, WAX, etc. have this function, and other blockchains do not have this function. Therefore, in order to no longer use the centralized database server, now we can only choose to use the EOS public blockchain or its derivative chain. When other public blockchains have this function in the future, we will also support such public blockchains.

In the future, EOS smart contracts will use the form of multi-signature for authority management, and use the form of DAO for governance. Therefore, the management authority of EOS smart contracts will be mastered by a DAO, that is, a decentralized autonomous organization, and will not be mastered by a single person or a private organization.

To sum up, this DApp system does not use a centralized database server to store and query data. EOS smart contracts are also governed by the DAO. Both aspects are decentralised.

3\.3 Web front-end service layer

The web front-end page of this DApp system is composed of static html and js files, as well as some image font resource files, etc. All files are static files. Anyone can download all the web front-end pages of this DApp system, put them on the web server they build, and they can run normally.

At present, the web front-end page of this DApp system is directly placed on the server of Netlify, a professional third-party static web page hosting provider. The development and operation team of this DApp system does not build and run a web server by itself.

When the functions of this DApp system are fully developed and run stably in the future, we will also build the web front-end page in the web front-end environment provided by third parties such as IPFS or Arweave. Other individuals or teams can also build the web front-end server of this DApp system in their own way.

Therefore, the web front-end service of this DApp system is also decentralized.

3\.4 Summary

After the above description, it can be seen that at all levels of this DApp system, there is no centralized server that depends on the development and operation team. The smart contracts that need to be governed are also governed in the form of DAOs. Assuming that the development and operation team completely withdraws from the project in the future, it will not affect the normal operation of this DApp system.

Therefore, we can see that this DApp system has achieved complete decentralization.

### 4. User Incentives and Economic Model

This DApp system will issue Tokens and NFTs for user incentives and governance. Early users will be incentivized by generous airdrops and more shares.

4\.1 Ordinary Articles

Users publish ordinary articles, and both authors and readers can get Token incentives. Authors are incentivized when they publish articles. Readers are incentivized when they like or reply to articles.

4\.2 Advertising Section

There will be an advertising promotion section on the homepage of this DApp system. After users pay Tokens, they can add their own articles or articles published by other users to this section and display them in this section. Readers who like or reply to articles in this section can receive tokens paid by the publisher. After all the tokens is collected by the reader, the article will be removed from this section and will no longer be displayed in this section.

4\.3 Like and Reward

Users can like or reward high-quality articles, replies, and NFT works. Rewards can be made using this DApp system token or mainstream token such as BTC, ETH, EOS, AR, etc. This will bring a certain amount of income to the author.

4\.4 NFT Trading Platform

This DApp system comes with an NFT trading platform, where authors can sell their NFT works and earn income.

When an NFT work is sold, the rewards received by the NFT work in the future or the proceeds from re-sale, or other potential future income, will be owned by the new owner. This provides buyers of NFT works with the opportunity to obtain income in the future. In addition, for each transaction of NFT works, the original author will receive a certain percentage of the share.

4\.5 High-quality content aggregation function

This DApp system has a built-in high-quality content aggregation function. For example, if the number of comments and replies of an article or NFT work reaches a certain value, it can enter the essence area. This function helps new users of this DApp system to find hot spots to participate. At the same time, NFT works entering the essence area may generate higher transaction prices. It helps authors to obtain higher income, and also helps buyers to buy popular works.

### 5. An NFT creation and trading platform that combines social functions

This is one of the features that distinguish the NFT platform of this DApp system from other NFT platforms. The author's original NFT works, including various types of NFT works, have a comment function after they are published. The author can interact with the audience in the form of comments and replies, and these comments and replies will also become part of the NFT and exist forever. The author can explain the meaning and significance of the work, tell the story of the work well, and be recognized by the audience. The resulting excellent works and popular works can easily be sold at higher prices. Buyers can buy popular and excellent works, and as the popularity and popularity of the authors increase in the future, the appreciation space of these works will also increase.

The DApp system will charge a certain percentage of transaction fees.

### 6. DAO Governance

This DApp system uses the form of DAO to manage smart contracts. The token obtained by the user during the token incentive also has the function of participating in the DAO governance voting. In addition, this DApp system will also issue an NFT, which also has both incentive and governance functions. Users who meet certain conditions can get NFT incentives.

In order to increase the difficulty of artificial manipulation of DAO governance voting, the DAO governance of this DApp system adopts a two-tier voting system, similar to the upper house and lower house of parliament, or the Senate and the House of Representatives. The House of Representatives uses tokens to vote to decide whether to pass the proposal. The Senate uses NFT votes to decide whether to reject the proposal. ## DreamRealNotes DApp Project White Paper v1.0

### 1. System Introduction

DreamRealNotes DApp, a completely decentralized Web3.0 social media platform, the articles, replies, pictures, videos, audios and other data published by users can be permanently stored and exist forever.

### 2. System Features

* The data published by the user is permanently stored and exists forever.


* A fully decentralized Web3.0 social media platform, governed by DAO, multi-chain aggregation.


* An NFT creation and trading platform that combines social functions.


* Users can publish articles, replies, pictures, videos, audios, etc. of any length in this DApp system.


* The above types of content posted by users automatically become a different NFT.


* This DApp system has social functions similar to Twitter. Users can post articles, post replies, forward articles, create personal profiles, follow other users, like, give rewards, and so on.

### 3. System Architecture

![System Architecture Diagram](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V2dBfj-j-5sY3WOO-v0ZA.png?height=502&width=865)

3\.1 Content data permanent storage layer and NFT own data permanent storage layer

Articles, replies, pictures, videos, and audios published by users in this DApp system, the content data of which is the data of the NFT itself, will be stored in the blocks of the public blockchain in two ways. Method 1: The data is directly stored in the blocks of the Arweave blockchain. Method 2: The data is stored in the blocks of ETH, EOS, BTC and other mainstream public blockchains in the form of remarks of blockchain transfer transactions among. The data stored in the block in these two ways is unmodifiable and undeletable, and can be perpetuated with the perpetuity of the public blockchain.

This DApp system supports users to store data into the blocks of ETH, Arweave, EOS, BTC, and other mainstream public blockchains.

Since these content data are stored in the blocks of the public blockchain, decentralization is achieved at the content data storage level.

3\.2 Catalog/Indexes Permanent Storage Layer and NFT Metadata Permanent Storage Layer

Articles, replies, pictures, videos, and audios published by users in this DApp system, their catalog data and index data, and metadata of NFT are stored in the smart contracts of the EOS public blockchain.

The reason for using EOS smart contract is that it has a data structure called "multi index table", which can add, delete, modify and query data like traditional relational databases, and use multiple indexes to query data. After using this function, the centralized database server can no longer be used to store and query data.

Among the current mainstream public blockchains, only EOS and its derivative chains such as Telos, WAX, etc. have this function, and other blockchains do not have this function. Therefore, in order to no longer use the centralized database server, now we can only choose to use the EOS public blockchain or its derivative chain. When other public blockchains have this function in the future, we will also support such public blockchains.

In the future, EOS smart contracts will use the form of multi-signature for authority management, and use the form of DAO for governance. Therefore, the management authority of EOS smart contracts will be mastered by a DAO, that is, a decentralized autonomous organization, and will not be mastered by a single person or a private organization.

To sum up, this DApp system does not use a centralized database server to store and query data. EOS smart contracts are also governed by the DAO. Both aspects are decentralised.

3\.3 Web front-end service layer

The web front-end page of this DApp system is composed of static html and js files, as well as some image font resource files, etc. All files are static files. Anyone can download all the web front-end pages of this DApp system, put them on the web server they build, and they can run normally.

At present, the web front-end page of this DApp system is directly placed on the server of Netlify, a professional third-party static web page hosting provider. The development and operation team of this DApp system does not build and run a web server by itself.

When the functions of this DApp system are fully developed and run stably in the future, we will also build the web front-end page in the web front-end environment provided by third parties such as IPFS or Arweave. Other individuals or teams can also build the web front-end server of this DApp system in their own way.

Therefore, the web front-end service of this DApp system is also decentralized.

3\.4 Summary

After the above description, it can be seen that at all levels of this DApp system, there is no centralized server that depends on the development and operation team. The smart contracts that need to be governed are also governed in the form of DAOs. Assuming that the development and operation team completely withdraws from the project in the future, it will not affect the normal operation of this DApp system.

Therefore, we can see that this DApp system has achieved complete decentralization.

### 4. User Incentives and Economic Model

This DApp system will issue Tokens and NFTs for user incentives and governance. Early users will be incentivized by generous airdrops and more shares.

4\.1 Ordinary Articles

Users publish ordinary articles, and both authors and readers can get Token incentives. Authors are incentivized when they publish articles. Readers are incentivized when they like or reply to articles.

There will be an advertising promotion section on the homepage of this DApp system. Users can like or reward high-quality articles, replies, and NFT works. Rewards can be made using this DApp system token or mainstream token such as BTC, ETH, EOS, AR, etc. This will bring a certain amount of income to the author.

This DApp system comes with an NFT trading platform, where authors can sell their NFT works and earn income.

When an NFT work is sold, the rewards received by the NFT work in the future or the proceeds from re-sale, or other potential future income, will be owned by the new owner. This provides buyers of NFT works with the opportunity to obtain income in the future. In addition, for each transaction of NFT works, the original author will receive a certain percentage of the share.

title: Projet Starkview
body:
## Quoi ? Quel est le projet ?

**Starkview a pour ambition d’aider les utilisateurs du réseau Starknet (blockchain )** en apportant des métriques qui aideront à la décision ainsi qu’à monitorer la blockchain.

**Exemple de fonctionnalités qui seront présentes :**

* TPS (transaction par secondes). Permet de savoir si le réseau est congestionné ou pas.
* TPD (transaction par jour/day). Permet de savoir si le réseau est de plus en plus utilisé ou pas.
* Et d’autres fonctionnalités qu’on détaillera après.

## Pourquoi ?

Pour aider les utilisateurs de cette blockchain.

## Pour qui ?

Pour tout le monde, c’est gratuit.  Ce sera sous forme d’un site vitrine (donc pas de paiement ni d’espace compte).

## Comment / Quelle architecture ?

Le site web sera le même pour tout les user (pas de variation)

Le script JS va chercher les datas et les affiches sous forme d’un graphique.

Voici un site qui fait la même chose que ce que je cherche à faire. *(ils ont fait ça lors d’un hackathon et du coup ils ne vont pas continuer)*

[https://www.starknet-ecosystem.com/en/metrics](https://www.starknet-ecosystem.com/en/metrics)

## Les datas

### On chain (via la datahouse de TokenFlow sur snowflake)

* Nombre de transactions par jour
* Nombre de transactions par minute
* Nombre de portefeuilles déployés
* Nombre de contrats déployés
* Nombre d'utilisateurs uniques par jour
* Montant des transactions par jour
* Volume in/out du bridge (eth/$)
* Valeur totale sur la chaîne (a voir si y'a pas trop de truc à blacklist)
* Moy. tx/utilisateur
* Valeur moyenne/utilisateur
* tracking des smart contract (donner le nom)
* TVL sur le L2
* Nombre de nœuds déployés
* % de ce que représente les tx starknet sur ethereum (en nombre & volume)

### Off chain :

Via API GitHub :

* Statistiques sur le repo github :

  <https://github.com/0xs34n/starknet.js>

Via API twitter :

* Nombre de tweet par jour contenant “starknet”
* Nombre de tweet par jour avec le hashtag #starkview
* Nombre de follower sur le twitter starkware (mesurer le nombre d’abonnés gagner par temps)

  <https://twitter.com/StarkWareLtd>

Collecte en Interne :

* La web app collectera les IP des visiteurs : représenter sur une map les pays qui utilise starkview.

## Première ébauche de la maquette : 

![La web app est structuré en "tableaux" chaque tableau regroupe des graphiques de même environement. ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/u6B_5moOgaj1Gh36sFdfU.png?height=3488&width=3840)

title: Pacer白皮书（中文版）
body:
## Pacer是什么？

* 1. 简介

  Pacer是一个 "健康-收入 "生态系统的超级应用，它奖励那些能够养成健康习惯并坚持这样做的用户。使用Pacer应用程序，用户能够养成良好的健康习惯，如健康的睡眠时间同时得到奖励。
* 生态系统

  Pacer将是一个健康生态系统的超级应用，它将奖励那些进行各种健康活动的用户，如良好的睡眠，定期练习正念和定期冥想。此外，如果用户在他们的健康旅程中坚持不懈，将得到进一步的奖励，并能够增加他们的收入。 Pacer将有多个环节来指导用户的健康之旅。由于睡眠是一个人保持健康的基本方面，"睡眠到收入 "将是Pacer生态系统的第一个部分。 接下来，涉及其他健康方面的其他部分将被纳入Pacer生态系统，从而使用户能够通过Pacer进一步推进其健康之旅。
* 2. 特点概述


* 主要特点（睡眠-收入部分）
* 奖励制度

  获得奖励将根据用户提供给Pacer的质量和数量决定
* 声纳跟踪

  声纳跟踪包括跟踪用户发出的噪音。睡眠的当前阶段也可以通过测量用户的打鼾和运动的方式确定。
* 智能/健身手表跟踪

  智能/健身手表将能够跟踪一个人的生命体征，监测各种生命指标。
* Oura戒指追踪

       Oura戒指将能够跟踪一个人的睡眠和活动水平，以衡量一个人的总体健康状况。

* 形成习惯

  用户将能够记录他们的健康习惯，以证明他们在健康习惯方面有稳定的记录。
* 睡眠算法

  对睡眠质量的跟踪 Pacer将有一个内置的算法，跟踪各种因素以确定用户的睡眠质量，从而用相当数量的代币对他们进行适当的奖励。 该算法将由一个曾在全球人工智能/ML企业组织工作过的专业团队在内部开发。

  Tokenomics 治理代币 $PACE是Pacer生态系统的治理代币。价值将主要累积到治理代币上，也将作为较高等级玩家的奖励代币（数量有限）。 实用代币 $ZZZ是睡眠-收入（S2E）部分的实用代币。用户将根据他们的睡眠质量和持续时间获得ZZZ美元的奖励。用户需要拥有一个枕头才能开始赚取$ZZZ代币。 为了减少系统的博弈，同时适当和公平地奖励用户，用户赚取的ZZZ美元将根据多种因素分层。

  第1层：基本跟踪：手机

  第2层：高级追踪：手机+智能手表

  第3层：专家级追踪：手机+智能手表+Oura
* 睡眠水晶（非SPL/ERC代币）

  免费和付费用户都可以获得的奖励点。用户将能够使用睡眠水晶来购买箱子，这些箱子能够掉落各种物品，从怪物皮肤到加速器到睡眠饮料。然而，没有枕头的用户将只能使用基础物品。未使用的 "高级 "物品将被保留在用户的库存中，并可在以后使用。

  3\. 枕头NFTS
* 枕头NFT是玩家能够开始赚取实用代币（$ZZZ）、睡眠水晶和最终的治理代币（$PACE）的必要条件，如果用户拥有足够高的枕头等级。每个枕头都会有决定各种因素的特征，包括：

  收益倍数

  持久性

  睡醒后有机会获得一个宝箱

  其他各种外观特征

  ```
  *非NFT枕头将可通过应用内购买，使用户能够开始赚取代币，但不会像NFT枕头很多功能。
  
   剩下是关于pacer的隐私政策，有兴趣的可以去查看英文版
  ```

[https://docs.pacer.gg/privacy-policies](https://docs.pacer.gg/privacy-policies)

title: DreamRealNotes_project_introduction_and_user_manual_cn_v1.0
body:
### A. 项目介绍

        梦想现实笔记DApp，完全去中心化的Web3.0社交媒体平台，用户发布的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频等等数据可以永久存储、永远存在。
        用户可以在本DApp系统发布任意长度的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频等等。
        用户发布的以上类型的内容都自动成为一个一个互不相同的NFT。
        本DApp系统拥有和微博、推特相似的社交功能，用户可以发布文章、发布回复、转发文章、创建个人资料、关注其他用户、点赞、打赏，等等。

### B. User Manual

### B. 用户手册

1\. Visit the DreamRealNotes DApp, open the link: https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html, enter the home page, as shown in the figure below:

1\. 访问梦想现实笔记DApp，打开链接：https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html ，进入首页，如下图所示：

![(Img A)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aSbhJsvazEOkyy-S6LDyD.png?height=332&width=1339)

2\. Click the small icon in the upper right corner of the home page, a pop-up menu will appear, as shown below:

2\. 点击首页右上角的小图标，出现弹出菜单，如下图：

![(Img B)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GD9JKOr1D1szbtcQUfKJ1.png?height=264&width=271)

3\. Click "EOS login" in the above picture, the Scatter login page will appear, as shown below, and then click the "Login" button to log in to your EOS account.

3\. 点击上图中的“EOS登录”，出现Scatter登录页面，如下图，然后点击“Login”按钮进行EOS帐户登录。

![(Img C)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WpblaByvwP5eTXxT6-pRL.png?height=647&width=355)

4\. Click the small icon in the upper right corner of the home page, a pop-up menu will appear, click "ETH Connect MetaMask" in it, as shown in the figure below, and then confirm the connection with this DApp in MetaMask.

4\. 点击首页右上角的小图标，出现弹出菜单，点击里面的“ETH连接MetaMask”，如下图，然后在MetaMask中确认与本DApp进行连接。

![(Img D)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o_CqqYR81_9OwiF0gas7C.png?height=260&width=266)

5\. Click the "Write an article" button in the lower left corner of the home page, and the following window will appear:

5\. 点击首页左下角的“写文章”按钮，出现如下窗口：

![(Img E)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VkqggC2x-GqlueFz9SLRI.png?height=595&width=541)

6\. In this window, select the article type, category, storage location, and fill in the article title and article content. Currently the storage location only supports ETH. When sending an ETH transfer transaction in the following steps, it is to transfer to the ETH account of the development team, and each transfer is 0.0005ETH (fixed value, cannot be modified, and may be adjusted in the future).

6\. 在本窗口中选择文章类型、类别、存储位置，填写文章标题、文章内容。目前存储位置只支持ETH。在后面的步骤中发送ETH转账交易时，是向开发团队的ETH账号进行转账，每次转账0.0005ETH（固定值，不可修改，未来可能会调整）。

7\. Click the "View number of txns" button in this window, and a prompt window will appear:

7\. 点击本窗口中的“查看交易次数”按钮，出现提示窗口：

![(Img F)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IqCsUWJPhvi-iJH7ouKRr.png?height=165&width=449)

8\. The prompt in the above figure means that a total of 2 transactions need to be sent, the first one is an ETH transfer transaction, and the last one is an EOS on-chain transaction. If the displayed number is 3, it means that the first two transactions are ETH transfer transactions, and the last one is an EOS on-chain transaction. If the displayed number is 10, it means that the first 9 transactions are ETH transfer transactions, and the last one is an EOS on-chain transaction. The larger the length of the article, the higher this number will be. The current setting is that each ETH transfer transaction can send up to 3336 characters. The entire article will be automatically split into multiple parts according to this length, and each transfer transaction sends one of these parts.

8\. 上图的提示意思是总共需要发送2次交易，前面1次是ETH转账交易，最后1次是EOS上链交易。如果显示的数字是3，则表示前面2次是ETH转账交易，最后1次是EOS上链交易。如果显示的数字是10，则表示前面9次是ETH转账交易，最后1次是EOS上链交易。文章的长度越大，这个数字就越大。目前的设置是每次ETH转账交易最多可以发送3336个汉字。整篇文章会自动按照这个长度拆分成多个部分，每个转账交易发送其中的一个部分。

9\. Click the "Post" button in the window in step 5 to start sending the article, and the MetaMask trading interface will pop up, as shown below:

9\. 在第5步的弹出窗口中点击“发送”按钮，开始进行文章发送，会弹出MetaMask交易界面，如下图：

![(Img G)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IvCuZOiKjEW-6_jWoDUf-.png?height=608&width=351)

10\. Click the "Edit" button in this interface, the following interface will appear, select the priority as high, which can speed up the execution and confirmation of the transaction, and then click the "Save" button.

10\. 在本界面中点击“编辑”按钮，出现如下界面，选择优先级为高，这样可以加快交易的执行和确认速度，然后点击“保存”按钮。

![(Img H)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wrrayeiEOVUi-owOQi1CK.png?height=609&width=346)

11\. After the previous operation, it will automatically return to the previous interface, as shown in the figure below, click the "Confirm" button to send the ETH transfer transaction.

11\. 上一步操作后，自动返回上一个界面，如下图，点“确认”按钮，发送ETH转账交易。

![(Img I)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NyYlAlQ1TKvveIE9aBgQC.png?height=609&width=350)

12\. If the article is long and you need to send multiple ETH transfer transactions, the DApp will automatically pop up the interface for each ETH transfer transaction, just follow the above method to send the transaction.

12\. 如果文章比较长，需要发送多次ETH转账交易，DApp会自动弹出每笔ETH转账交易的界面，只需按照如上的方法发送交易即可。

13\. When all ETH transfer transactions are sent, the DApp will automatically pop up the Scatter authorization interface for EOS on-chain transaction, as shown below:

13\. 当所有的ETH转账交易都发送完毕后，DApp会自动弹出EOS上链交易的Scatter授权界面，如下图：

![(Img J)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iHeuByQvbwQ7_HHaV5vtP.png?height=645&width=356)

14\. You can click the "Details" tab in the image above to view the details of the transaction, as shown below:

14\. 可以点击上图中的“Details”页签，查看交易的细节，如下图：

![(Img K)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nGsTmwCuemqj99l3K-CFT.png?height=652&width=357)

15\. Click the "Sign" button in the image above to authorize.

15\. 点击上图中的“Sign”按钮，进行授权。

16\. After the authorization is completed, the following prompt window will pop up, indicating that all transactions have been sent, click the "OK" button.

16\. 授权完毕后，会弹出如下提示窗口，表示交易全部发送完成，点“确定”按钮。

![(Img L)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VnybN8dXdHzR6JF0TEvM1.png?height=129&width=446)

17\. If there is a transaction failure error message during the process of sending the transaction, such as insufficient ETH balance, insufficient EOS CPU resources, etc., do not refresh the DApp page at this time, but use another wallet or tool to solve the error in the error prompt. Once the error is solved, then click the "Resume from break point" button on the DApp page to continue sending the transaction from the place where the error occurred.

17\. 如果在发送交易的过程中出现交易失败的错误提示，比如ETH余额不足、EOS的CPU资源不足等等，此时不要刷新DApp页面，而是使用别的钱包或者工具，将错误提示中的错误解决掉，然后点击DApp页面中的“断点续传”按钮，就可以从发生错误的地方继续进行交易的发送。

18\. After all transactions are successfully sent, wait for a few minutes, click another Tab page at the top of the DApp home page, and then click back, which can refresh the list of articles in the Real Notes and Dream Notes. In the corresponding Tab page, you can see the new article just published. As shown below:

18\. 所有交易成功发送完毕后，稍等几分钟，在DApp首页点击顶部的另一个Tab页，然后再点击回来，这样可以刷新现实笔记和梦想笔记中的文章列表。在对应的Tab页中就可以看到刚才发布的新文章了。如下图：

![(Img M)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vjIACK1rvd5IlC3a1jhbs.png?height=313&width=1333)

19\. You can go to the ETH blockchain browser to verify whether the content of the article is stored in ETH. Click the article id above the article preview in the image above, and a prompt box will pop up, as shown below:

19\. 可以到ETH区块链浏览器验证一下文章内容是否存储到ETH上了。点击上图中文章预览上方的文章id，弹出提示框，如下图：

![(Img N)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Cc0PfTun17-rNhCwPXgN-.png?height=170&width=451)

20\. Double-click the long hash string displayed in the above prompt box with the mouse to select the hash string and copy it to the clipboard. Note that there may be a bug in Google Chrome. Sometimes when you double-click the hash string with the mouse, it shows that the hash string is not completely selected, only a part of it is selected, and some letters are not selected. If this is the case, ignore it, the hash string has been completely and correctly selected.

20\. 在上面的提示框中用鼠标双击显示的长长的hash字符串，就可以选中这个hash字符串，然后复制到剪贴板。注意，这里可能有个谷歌浏览器的bug，有时候用鼠标双击hash字符串的时候，显示出hash字符串没有被完全选中，只选中了一部分，有几个字母没有被选中。如果遇到这种情况，不用理会，hash字符串已经被完全并且正确选中了。

21\. Visit the ETH blockchain browser, the link is: https://etherscan.io, paste the hash string copied in the previous step into the search box, search, and the following page appears:

21\. 访问ETH区块链浏览器，链接为：https://etherscan.io ，将上一步复制的hash字符串粘贴进搜索框，进行搜索，出现如下页面：

![(Img O)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z-JVQgTeBiIdiVhbyqWdr.png?height=601&width=1319)

![(Img P)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zrVbc12bU3EQpcA8OTa3A.png?height=242&width=1322)

22\. In the Input Data section at the bottom of the page, select "View As UTF8" to see the content of the article. If the {} at the beginning contains a hash string, continue to search for the hash string, and the next part of the article will be searched. Repeat this process until you find one starting with {}, then this is the last part of the article.

22\. 在页面底部的Input Data部分，选择“View As UTF8”，就可以看到文章的内容。如果开头的{}中含有一个hash字符串，则继续搜索这个hash字符串，将会搜索到文章的下一部分。重复这个过程，直到搜索到一个以{}开头的，那么这个就是文章的最后一部分。

23\. In the Gas Limit & Usage by Txn section, you can see the actual amount of Gas consumed by the transaction, which is only about 25% of the estimated amount in article "Must Read and Agreement for Community Users".

23\. 在Gas Limit & Usage by Txn部分，可以看到交易实际消耗的Gas数量，只有“社区用户必读和用户协议”这篇文章中估算的25%左右。

24\. At this point, the verification is completed, and the content of the article has indeed been stored in the ETH block.

24\. 到此，验证完毕，文章内容确实被存储进了ETH的区块之中。

25\. If the user chooses another storage location when sending the article, the operation process is basically the same.

25\. 如果用户在发送文章时选择的是其它的存储位置，操作过程基本上是一样的。

body:
## Pacer是什么？

* 1.简介

  Pacer是一个 "健康-收入 "生态系统的超级应用，它奖励那些能够养成健康习惯并坚持这样做的用户。使用Pacer应用程序，用户能够养成良好的健康习惯，如健康的睡眠时间同时得到奖励。
* 生态系统

  Pacer将是一个健康生态系统的超级应用，它将奖励那些进行各种健康活动的用户，如良好的睡眠，定期练习正念和定期冥想。此外，如果用户在他们的健康旅程中坚持不懈，将得到进一步的奖励，并能够增加他们的收入。 Pacer将有多个环节来指导用户的健康之旅。由于睡眠是一个人保持健康的基本方面，"睡眠到收入 "将是Pacer生态系统的第一个部分。 接下来，涉及其他健康方面的其他部分将被纳入Pacer生态系统，从而使用户能够通过Pacer进一步推进其健康之旅。

  2\.特点概述
* 主要特点（睡眠-收入部分）
* 奖励制度

  获得奖励将根据用户提供给Pacer的质量和数量决定
* 声纳跟踪

  声纳跟踪包括跟踪用户发出的噪音。睡眠的当前阶段也可以通过测量用户的打鼾和运动的方式确定。
* 智能/健身手表跟踪

  智能/健身手表将能够跟踪一个人的生命体征，监测各种生命指标。
* Oura戒指追踪

  Oura戒指将能够跟踪一个人的睡眠和活动水平，以衡量一个人的总体健康状况。
* 形成习惯

  用户将能够记录他们的健康习惯，以证明他们在健康习惯方面有稳定的记录。
* 睡眠算法

  对睡眠质量的跟踪 Pacer将有一个内置的算法，跟踪各种因素以确定用户的睡眠质量，从而用相当数量的代币对他们进行适当的奖励。 该算法将由一个曾在全球人工智能/ML企业组织工作过的专业团队在内部开发。

  Tokenomics 治理代币 $PACE是Pacer生态系统的治理代币。价值将主要累积到治理代币上，也将作为较高等级玩家的奖励代币（数量有限）。 实用代币 $ZZZ是睡眠-收入（S2E）部分的实用代币。用户将根据他们的睡眠质量和持续时间获得ZZZ美元的奖励。用户需要拥有一个枕头才能开始赚取$ZZZ代币。 为了减少系统的博弈，同时适当和公平地奖励用户，用户赚取的ZZZ美元将根据多种因素分层。

  第1层：基本跟踪：手机

  第2层：高级追踪：手机+智能手表

  第3层：专家级追踪：手机+智能手表+Oura
* 睡眠水晶（非SPL/ERC代币）

  免费和付费用户都可以获得的奖励点。用户将能够使用睡眠水晶来购买箱子，这些箱子能够掉落各种物品，从怪物皮肤到加速器到睡眠饮料。然而，没有枕头的用户将只能使用基础物品。未使用的 "高级 "物品将被保留在用户的库存中，并可在以后使用。

  3\. 枕头NFTS
* 枕头NFT是玩家能够开始赚取实用代币（$ZZZ）、睡眠水晶和最终的治理代币（$PACE）的必要条件，如果用户拥有足够高的枕头等级。每个枕头都会有决定各种因素的特征，包括：

  收益倍数

  持久性

  睡醒后有机会获得一个宝箱

  其他各种外观特征

  ```
  *非NFT枕头将可通过应用内购买，使用户能够开始赚取代币，但不会像NFT枕头很多功能。
  
   剩下是关于pacer的隐私政策，有兴趣的可以去查看英文版
  ```

[https://docs.pacer.gg/privacy-policies](https://docs.pacer.gg/privacy-policies)

## 梦想现实笔记项目介绍和用户手册 v1.0

### A. 项目介绍

        梦想现实笔记DApp，完全去中心化的Web3.0社交媒体平台，用户发布的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频等等数据可以永久存储、永远存在。
        用户可以在本DApp系统发布任意长度的文章、回复、图片、视频、音频等等。
        用户发布的以上类型的内容都自动成为一个一个互不相同的NFT。
        本DApp系统拥有和微博、推特相似的社交功能，用户可以发布文章、发布回复、转发文章、创建个人资料、关注其他用户、点赞、打赏，等等。

        项目网址：        <https://dreamrealnotes.netlify.app/home.html>

        本DApp系统需要同时联合使用ETH、Arweave、EOS三个区块链，其中ETH和Arweave负责存储文章、图片、视频、音频的内容数据，EOS智能合约负责存储它们的目录和索引数据。
        使用手机钱包App访问本DApp系统，只能进行浏览和查看的操作，不能进行其他操作。因为现有的手机钱包App不支持同时在多个区块链上进行操作。
        为了使用本DApp系统的完整功能，建议使用个人电脑、谷歌浏览器、MetaMask插件钱包、ArConnect插件钱包、Scatter桌面版钱包。

        本DApp系统目前已经实现的主要功能有：
        (1) 用户可以发布文章、回复、图片、视频、音频。
        (2) 用户可以创建个人资料。
        (3) 用户可以关注别的用户或者取消关注，查看关注用户发表的文章，等等。

        下一步将要实现的主要功能如下（2022年第3季度和第4季度）：
        (1) 发行激励Token和NFT。
        (2) 实现对文章、回复进行点赞、打赏的功能。
        (3) 实现NFT交易功能。

If there is a transaction failure error message during the process of sending the transaction, such as insufficient ETH balance, insufficient EOS CPU resources, etc., do not refresh the DApp page at this time, but use another wallet or tool to solve the error in the error prompt. Once the error is solved, then click the "Resume from break point" button on the DApp page to continue sending the transaction from the place where the error occurred.

17\. 如果在发送交易的过程中出现交易失败的错误提示，比如ETH余额不足、EOS的CPU资源不足等等，此时不要刷新DApp页面，而是使用别的钱包或者工具，将错误提示中的错误解决掉，然后点击DApp页面中的“断点续传”按钮，就可以从发生错误的地方继续进行交易的发送。

18\. After all transactions are successfully sent, wait for a few minutes, click another Tab page at the top of the DApp home page, and then click back, which can refresh the list of articles in the Real Notes and Dream Notes. In the corresponding Tab page, you can see the new article just published. As shown below:

18\. 所有交易成功发送完毕后，稍等几分钟，在DApp首页点击顶部的另一个Tab页，然后再点击回来，这样可以刷新现实笔记和梦想笔记中的文章列表。在对应的Tab页中就可以看到刚才发布的新文章了。如下图：

![(Img M)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vjIACK1rvd5IlC3a1jhbs.png?height=313&width=1333)

19\. You can go to the ETH blockchain browser to verify whether the content of the article is stored in ETH. Click the article id above the article preview in the image above, and a prompt box will pop up, as shown below:

19\. 可以到ETH区块链浏览器验证一下文章内容是否存储到ETH上了。点击上图中文章预览上方的文章id，弹出提示框，如下图：

![(Img N)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Cc0PfTun17-rNhCwPXgN-.png?height=170&width=451)

20\. Double-click the long hash string displayed in the above prompt box with the mouse to select the hash string and copy it to the clipboard. Note that there may be a bug in Google Chrome. Sometimes when you double-click the hash string with the mouse, it shows that the hash string is not completely selected, only a part of it is selected, and some letters are not selected. If this is the case, ignore it, the hash string has been completely and correctly selected.

20\. 在上面的提示框中用鼠标双击显示的长长的hash字符串，就可以选中这个hash字符串，然后复制到剪贴板。注意，这里可能有个谷歌浏览器的bug，有时候用鼠标双击hash字符串的时候，显示出hash字符串没有被完全选中，只选中了一部分，有几个字母没有被选中。如果遇到这种情况，不用理会，hash字符串已经被完全并且正确选中了。

21\. Visit the ETH blockchain browser, the link is: https://etherscan.io, paste the hash string copied in the previous step into the search box, search, and the following page appears:

21\. 访问ETH区块链浏览器，链接为：https://etherscan.io ，将上一步复制的hash字符串粘贴进搜索框，进行搜索，出现如下页面：

![(Img O)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z-JVQgTeBiIdiVhbyqWdr.png?height=601&width=1319)

![(Img P)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zrVbc12bU3EQpcA8OTa3A.png?height=242&width=1322)

22\. In the Input Data section at the bottom of the page, select "View As UTF8" to see the content of the article. If the {} at the beginning contains a hash string, continue to search for the hash string, and the next part of the article will be searched. Repeat this process until you find one starting with {}, then this is the last part of the article.

22\. 在页面底部的Input Data部分，选择“View As UTF8”，就可以看到文章的内容。如果开头的{}中含有一个hash字符串，则继续搜索这个hash字符串，将会搜索到文章的下一部分。重复这个过程，直到搜索到一个以{}开头的，那么这个就是文章的最后一部分。

23\. In the Gas Limit & Usage by Txn section, you can see the actual amount of Gas consumed by the transaction, which is only about 25% of the estimated amount in article "Must Read and Agreement for Community Users".

23\. 在Gas Limit & Usage by Txn部分，可以看到交易实际消耗的Gas数量，只有“社区用户必读和用户协议”这篇文章中估算的25%左右。

24\. At this point, the verification is completed, and the content of the article has indeed been stored in the ETH block.

24\. 到此，验证完毕，文章内容确实被存储进了ETH的区块之中。

25\. If the user chooses another storage location when sending the article, the operation process is basically the same.

25\. 如果用户在发送文章时选择的是其它的存储位置，操作过程基本上是一样的。

C. 关于使用ArConnect钱包的注意事项

        ArConnect是Arweave区块链的谷歌浏览器插件钱包，安装使用方法和MetaMask类似。有一点不同的是，在使用ArConnect钱包发送交易时，不是发送每个交易都需要用户点击一次授权或者确认按钮，这一点要注意。
        用户使用本DApp系统将文章、图片、视频、音频等等上传到Arweave区块链的时候，点了发送按钮之后，可能不会弹出ArConnect的确认窗口，此时用户请耐心等待一会，当ArConnect完成交易签名并将交易发送完成之后，整个发送流程会自动继续进行。
        另外，中国的用户在向Arweave区块链发送交易的时候，需要棵\~学\~上\~网并且打开全局代理的模式。

title: Pacer白皮书（中文版）
body:
## Pacer是什么？

* 1.简介

  Pacer是一个 "健康-收入 "生态系统的超级应用，它奖励那些能够养成健康习惯并坚持这样做的用户。使用Pacer应用程序，用户能够养成良好的健康习惯，如健康的睡眠时间同时得到奖励。
* 生态系统

  Pacer将是一个健康生态系统的超级应用，它将奖励那些进行各种健康活动的用户，如良好的睡眠，定期练习正念和定期冥想。此外，如果用户在他们的健康旅程中坚持不懈，将得到进一步的奖励，并能够增加他们的收入。 Pacer将有多个环节来指导用户的健康之旅。由于睡眠是一个人保持健康的基本方面，"睡眠到收入 "将是Pacer生态系统的第一个部分。 接下来，涉及其他健康方面的其他部分将被纳入Pacer生态系统，从而使用户能够通过Pacer进一步推进其健康之旅。

  2\.特点概述
* 主要特点（睡眠-收入部分）
* 奖励制度

  获得奖励将根据用户提供给Pacer的质量和数量决定
* 声纳跟踪

  声纳跟踪包括跟踪用户发出的噪音。睡眠的当前阶段也可以通过测量用户的打鼾和运动的方式确定。
* 智能/健身手表跟踪

  智能/健身手表将能够跟踪一个人的生命体征，监测各种生命指标。
* Oura戒指追踪

  Oura戒指将能够跟踪一个人的睡眠和活动水平，以衡量一个人的总体健康状况。
* 形成习惯

  用户将能够记录他们的健康习惯，以证明他们在健康习惯方面有稳定的记录。
* 睡眠算法

  对睡眠质量的跟踪 Pacer将有一个内置的算法，跟踪各种因素以确定用户的睡眠质量，从而用相当数量的代币对他们进行适当的奖励。 该算法将由一个曾在全球人工智能/ML企业组织工作过的专业团队在内部开发。

  Tokenomics 治理代币 $PACE是Pacer生态系统的治理代币。价值将主要累积到治理代币上，也将作为较高等级玩家的奖励代币（数量有限）。 实用代币 $ZZZ是睡眠-收入（S2E）部分的实用代币。用户将根据他们的睡眠质量和持续时间获得ZZZ美元的奖励。用户需要拥有一个枕头才能开始赚取$ZZZ代币。 为了减少系统的博弈，同时适当和公平地奖励用户，用户赚取的ZZZ美元将根据多种因素分层。

  第1层：基本跟踪：手机

  第2层：高级追踪：手机+智能手表

  第3层：专家级追踪：手机+智能手表+Oura
* 睡眠水晶（非SPL/ERC代币）

  免费和付费用户都可以获得的奖励点。用户将能够使用睡眠水晶来购买箱子，这些箱子能够掉落各种物品，从怪物皮肤到加速器到睡眠饮料。然而，没有枕头的用户将只能使用基础物品。未使用的 "高级 "物品将被保留在用户的库存中，并可在以后使用。

  3\. 枕头NFTS
* 枕头NFT是玩家能够开始赚取实用代币（$ZZZ）、睡眠水晶和最终的治理代币（$PACE）的必要条件，如果用户拥有足够高的枕头等级。每个枕头都会有决定各种因素的特征，包括：

  收益倍数

  持久性

  睡醒后有机会获得一个宝箱

  其他各种外观特征

  ```
  *非NFT枕头将可通过应用内购买，使用户能够开始赚取代币，但不会像NFT枕头很多功能。
  
   剩下是关于pacer的隐私政策，有兴趣的可以去查看英文版
  ```

[https://docs.pacer.gg/privacy-policies](https://docs.pacer.gg/privacy-policies)
