title: Creator & Ownership Economy
body:
## A primer on the state of Web3.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*ZkS5pAms5idBlsVFauZ6cQ.png)

I strongly believe that the next wave of computing innovation along with entirely new sectors of the economy will be built on decentralized technology. This technology has rapidly evolved beyond its financial origins. The community encompasses constituencies ranging from musicians and artists to small business owners and government agencies. Smart regulation must reflect the diversity of potential users and use cases.

Decentralized technologies offer an alternative to a digital status quo that is increasingly dominated by big tech and oppressive regimes. Open, democratized systems can provide the infrastructure to power tomorrow’s economy and institutions. Realizing that potential will depend on collaboration between the government and the private sector to develop regulatory frameworks that encourage innovation while managing the risks inherent in different applications.

Before we start exploring the next iteration of the creator economy, through the lens of Web3 platforms, let’s take a step back and explore the history of the creator economy since the inception of the internet.

## Web1 | The Information Economy → Content consumers (1985)

During the first era of the internet from the 1980s through the early 2000s internet services were built on **open protocols** (e.g., TCP, IP, SMTP, HTTP). This created a stable, level playing field on which to build the ecosystem of the internet. It was during this period of innovation that many of the biggest web properties were started.

> **Web1: “Read- Only”**

*Web1* refers to the first version of the web: **read-only**. Also called ***‘The Information Economy’.*** Web1 examples are static web and personal sites, where the users’ role was mainly limited to reading the information provided by a few content producers, with no option for them to circle back to those creators. An example is AOL, which was consumption-only.

## Web2 | Creators = Bloggers → Brand representatives (2004)

During the second era of the internet from the mid-2000s to the present businesses built a second layer of proprietary, **closed protocols** on top of the internet’s *open protocols*. This has been a period of centralization, as for-profit tech companies most notably \*Google, Apple, Facebook, \*and *Amazon* built software and services that rapidly outpaced the capabilities of open protocols.

As more people started gravitating to the internet, **Web2** saw the rise of influential people who started blogging, gradually amassing significant fame and online audiences on platforms such as [MySpace](https://myspace.com/), [Blogger](https://www.blogger.com/about/?bpli=1), [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/) as well as Vinyl.

> **Web2: “Read → Write”**

This is the world of **Web 2.0**. As the saying goes: “If you’re not paying for it, you’re not the customer. You’re the product.”

Thereafter, Web2 creators started monetizing their audience primarily via advertising, becoming the channels for other brands — allowing creators to earn revenue through affiliate advertising and sponsorship agreements. However, they were just the conduits of these other brands and businesses with no loyal attachment to the company.

## Web3 | No more platform monopolies → Creator Ownership.

We are now in the early stages of developing **Web3**, in which communities are incentivized and rewarded for maintaining and developing core infrastructure.

In Web3, the definition of creator is changing as power dynamics shift from the *platforms to the creators and their communities*.

> Today, the creator economy is no longer just about providing value to the platforms, it’s about new forms of **direct creator-community relationships**. There is an opportunity for creators \*not only \*to offer more to their fans (including financial upside) \*but for both creators and their communities \*to finally be able to participate in the collective value that they help platforms create.

![Source: State of Crypto 2022](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*N5FR6ufSdLNPjs-VcAU4Sg.png)

### Why does it matter?

The decentralized networks of web3 offer an alternative to the broken digital status quo.

While centralization has helped billions of people get access to amazing technologies, many of which were free to use, it has also stifled innovation.

Right now, companies that own networks have unilateral power over important questions like who gets network access, how revenue is divided, what features are supported, how user data is secured, and so on. That makes it harder for startups, creators, and other groups to grow their internet presence because they must worry about centralized platforms changing the rules and taking away their audiences or profits.

> **Web3: “Read → Write → Own”**

The classic challenge of decentralized networks is that they are public goods. Without a central entity to control decisions and capture profits, it is hard to incentivize their maintenance and development. Crypto helps solve this problem through decentralized coordination and providing economic incentives for development. ***web3 will put power in the hands of communities rather than corporations.***

Decentralized networks are an important counter to the fragility of centralized applications. Decentralized systems avoid single points of failure. Decentralized networks can also neutralize the unilateral control exerted by centralized platforms.

## The New Creator Economy: A Community-owned Ecosystem

The Creator Economy refers to emerging communities of creators artists, musicians, and game developers who connect directly with their supporters and collaborate without intermediaries, enabling them to develop independent income streams.

> “The **Creator Economy** is a subset of the **passion economy** the emerging category of businesses founded by self-employed content creators, supported by the digital platforms and financial tools that make the monetization of content viable.”

> Platforms are becoming community-led where both creators and their audience members have the opportunity to have greater upside based on their contributions.

## ***Why does it matter??***

For many people, especially younger people who are spending more and more time online and in digital spaces, it is becoming increasingly popular to own digital versions of physical assets. Books, music, and movies like photographs exist as digital files saved on hard drives or in the cloud.

When you purchase a **Non-Fungible Token (NFT)**, it’s yours to control as you see fit, similar to when you buy a physical good. You can transfer it, sell it, collateralize it, lend it, or keep it for yourself to admire. Early use cases for NFTs include digital art, games, sports memorabilia, and collectibles.

**NFTs** offer creators *new ways to monetize, bypassing traditional gatekeepers and giving fans a direct stake in their success*. They’re better for creators, who can sell their work directly without having to rely on middlemen (for example, artists who used to sell their artwork in galleries that took a cut or charged a fee). And they’re better for fans because they become owners, giving them an increased stake in the artists and creators they support.

Since NFTs are verifiable digital property rights, they also have many potential applications beyond the Creator Economy

## The difference between creators and influencers

While influencers depend on brand deals, creators monetize their content directly through their audience via donations, tip jars, or paid community subscriptions.

![Source: Antler](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*EfLLPrGJ2KS5QU8n_EQeLQ.png)

**Influencers** promote brands, products, services, affiliate links, or their merchandise. For them, content is a way to increase their followers and reach which in turn increases their price on the market.

**Creators**, on the other hand, focus only on the quality of content they produce. Through educational or entertaining content they hope to meet the interest and overcome the challenges of a specific audience.

The creator economy is estimated to be at **$104.2 billion**, with a noticeable growth rate when compared to that of the [Gig Economy](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/g/gig-economy.asp) (trillion-dollar valuation in the future).

![Source: Gumroad](https://miro.medium.com/max/1204/1\*F0u6GyBRBd2JPkAGx_wJhQ.png)

Creators combine multiple software tools to assemble a plethora of revenue streams in line with their style, no matter how niche. That’s a win for creators as well as everyone else. Because creators can finally build a real career while producing content tuned to every sub-culture in the rainbow.

***Here are some notable insights about the creator economy.***

## Creator Market Size

If you consider that the Gig Economy is estimated to be valued at anywhere between **$1–4.5 Trillion by 2023** and the Creator Economy is on a similar trajectory, then we’ve got some bold growth ahead of us — to **$1 Trillion**, and beyond! \*\*Creators are businesses themselves. \*\*The faster you realize that the quicker you can jump into this exploding market.

> From social media platforms to other industries like Influencer Marketing to the more than 50 million Creators themselves to the 500+ new startups joining the scene, the Creator Economy is attracting multi-billion dollar attention.

![Source: Influencer Marketing Hub](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*xuY7rBxAF9oHxjwp0YTm3g.png)

### Creators’ Earning Power

The side-by-side comparison of Creator size, income, and engagement shows the rising control Creators have over their accounts as full-time occupations and outlets for passion.

Earning power increases with time in the industry. **46%** of Creators who have been building an audience for **4+ years earn over $20k annually** across their monetized channels.

![Source: Influencer Marketing Hub](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*fpE3MXvXaoZwe7YpRHr0mA.png)

### Measuring Success

![Source: Influencer Marketing Hub](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*T4_OXiVFQZmz3R6Th_ZE7w.png)

Though income is most important for living costs, Creators on **4 out of 7 platforms listed Engagement Rate as their top measure of success,** if they had to pick just one. Given the importance of reaching for personal branding and sponsorships, it’s no surprise that **17.11% of the Creators** key in on engagement.

![Source: Influencer Marketing Hub](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*jfAla0nZDEl6pWY4GTv1Iw.png)

### Content Creator Employees' Age Breakdown

Brands are hiring in-house content creators today and they are an integrated part of social media and marketing teams. But, these aren’t the typical content creators that you would think of for non-company-owned social media channels.

The age breakdown of content creator employees is much older with an \*\*average age of 30-40 years old \*\*definitely not Gen Z. Within the 30-40-year-old age bracket, this group accounts for **40%** of the employee content creators. ***Should more brands be skewing younger?***

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*uSYZbbnpqfhOOdeLnFFO9Q.png)

## Creators are the new founders 💫

Despite many creators facing challenges, there remains sufficient optimism for the creator economy to continue to expand. It gives new hope to people and opportunities for them to follow their passions. In this Covid-raved world, the creator economy offers unique opportunities for people to work from home and concentrate on the skills they have developed over time.

We’re at an inflection point in history where becoming a professionalized creator is one of the most desired jobs. Creators become creators because they love to create. As they grow their audience and expand their revenue channels, the burden of managing the day to day of their business grows heavier. Startups that will dominate the next stage of this evolution are ones that are centered around empowering creators to seamlessly monetize while staying focused on what they already love creating content.

> **Here is my twitter thread summarizing What is Web3 .**

[https://twitter.com/rohit_gajaraj/status/1541868809119707141?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1541868809119707141%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Frohit_gajaraj%2Fstatus%2F1541868809119707141image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07](https://twitter.com/rohit_gajaraj/status/1541868809119707141?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1541868809119707141%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Frohit_gajaraj%2Fstatus%2F1541868809119707141image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07)

## Notable Insights

* $800 million in venture capital has been invested into Creator Economy startups since October 2020.
* 46% of Creators \*\*who has been building an audience for **4+ years earn over $20k annually** across their monetized channels.
* We estimate the **total Creator Economy market size to be around $104.2 Billion** and on par with a substantial growth trajectory similar to the Gig Economy. That’s a future valuation of TRILLIONS of dollars.
* **72% of Creators prefer Instagram and identify it as their primary content platform.**
* Of the [surveyed Creators](https://influencers.club/2021/07/19/what-is-a-creator/#:\~:text=The%20creator%20economy%20is%20consisted,dollar%20valuation%20in%20the%20future).) that considered themselves full-time Creators, ie. content creation is their main source of income-**78% make more than $23,500 annually.**
* The power of sponsorships should not be underestimated. 77% of Creators depend on brand deals, that’s **3x as many as every other revenue source combined.**
* There is not a definite correlation between follower count and income. Between the $50–100k and $500k-1M reported income levels from creating content, there are **half a million dollars in income difference, but a difference of only 1.8K more followers.**

## The Ownership Economy

Thirty years into the development of the world wide web, a handful of companies control most user attention and advertising revenue, with closed ecosystems that hold back innovation by independent developers. The economic interests of the biggest internet platforms are poorly aligned with their most valuable contributors: their users.

Ownership has long been embraced by Silicon Valley startups to align incentives among employees through option grants. S**till, the vast majority of internet users own exactly 0% of the services they contribute to.** Creators don’t own their content **“NFTs make the internet ownable”**, 2021, developers can’t control their code, and consumers can’t influence the policies or decisions of the platforms they use.

> “The products and services that will define Web3 and the next generation of the internet are those that turn users into owners. We call this the ownership economy.” The ownership economy 2022 — Variant Fund

This scenario, which once went unquestioned, looks increasingly archaic. This is starting to change via the ownership economy often referred to as web3 with products and services that turn users into owners. What started with Bitcoin and Ethereum both of which reward participants who secure the network with their native tokens is becoming prevalent across all categories of software, from developer infrastructure and new financial markets in DeFi to consumer products, marketplaces, and social.

> Amidst all this growth, we need to take a step back and re-introduce this ecosystem through some fundamental questions: *what is the ownership economy? How big is it, and where is it headed? What trends are defining its current state and possible future?*

### What is it all about? 🤨

The ownership economy in its present form is an evolution of the *sharing economy.* This new economy \*\*\*builds on economic rewards from user participation, network effects, computing resources, community, and access to financial freedoms \*\*\*debased from traditional models.

The ownership economy gives people rights, sharing freedoms, monetization streams, and access through protocols to truly determine how they wish to participate, rather than a rigid form set by centralized systems. It means that the owner the user will determine how novel rewards, platform governance, or new forms of social capital will shape the future of user-generated value.

> Simply put: the products and services that will define web3 and the next generation of the internet are those that transform users into owners. We call this the ownership economy

### Why does it matter? - A new internet owned by users

If the last generation of software was built upon a foundation of **user-generated content**, the next generation of software will be **user-owned**, with digital ownership leveraged as a building block to enable novel user experiences. At its core, the ownership economy not only offers a powerful new tool for builders to leverage market incentives to jumpstart new networks it also holds the potential to create positive social change through the wider distribution of wealth-building assets.

> **Here is my twitter thread 🧵 summarizing what creator & ownership economy is all.**

[https://twitter.com/rohit_gajaraj/status/1541906555003514881?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1541906555003514881%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Frohit_gajaraj%2Fstatus%2F1541906555003514881image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07](https://twitter.com/rohit_gajaraj/status/1541906555003514881?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1541906555003514881%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Frohit_gajaraj%2Fstatus%2F1541906555003514881image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07)

## The ownership economy is big and growing 🚀

As of April 26th, 2022, the market capitalization of the over 19,000 tokens tracked by data aggregator CoinMarketCap is **[$1.76 trillion](https://coinmarketcap.com/)**. For comparison, the market capitalization of global stock markets is over [$100 trillion](https://www.sifma.org/resources/research/research-quarterly-equities/).

The largest crypto networks by market capitalization are established layer 1 blockchains: [Bitcoin](http://bitcoin.org/) ($725 billion), which was launched in 2009, and [Ethereum](https://ethereum.org/en/) ($337 billion), which was launched in 2015. Other layer 1s in the top 20 tokens by market capitalization include [Solana](https://solana.com/), [Polkadot](https://polkadot.network/), [Terra](https://www.terra.money/), and [Avalanche](https://www.avax.network/).

![Source: Variant Fund](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*JpIkqdyxypiSPDwKt3J8zw.png)

We can also think about the scale of the ownership economy in terms of people the users who become owners of the networks they build.

## Paradigm Shifts in the Ownership Economy

Today, user ownership is transforming how people transact, invest, create, build, play, learn, communicate, and socialize.

### ✨Paradigm 1: Accessibility in the digital era shifting learned behavior

One of the key advantages of blockchain technology is the removal of intermediaries and supporting financial freedoms for individuals. While many advances have been made toward that end, without the ease of access, mass adoption cannot occur. Accessibility has remained the greatest barrier to cryptocurrency adoption and the advancement of a truly decentralized marketplace.

There has yet to be a natural on-ramp that clears the accessibility hurdle, while gradually evolving learned behavior to adopt cryptocurrency. ***Making the Digital Economy accessible and eliminating current barriers to entry that impede mass-market adoption***

### ✨Paradigm 2: The key to Ownership

The advent of the digital era has brought with it an unprecedented generation of new value. New assets and commodities have generated incredible wealth for those able to create, extract, store and trade them.

As it stands though, the largest players in Big Data are intermediaries, adding friction to ecosystems while often treating individuals solely as resources to be exploited. Custodianship of user data has remained with the companies that collect it. For the most part, individuals are being ignored when the value their data generates is distributed they have been mostly removed from the upside of this digital commodity. ***The key to individual participation in the Digital Economy will be ownership and control of their own data.***

### ✨Paradigm 3: Decentralization and WEB3

As the world works through this age of digital transformation, a massive shift in trajectory is also upon us. Since the start of the global pandemic, society has undergone a rapid acceleration in the adoption of all things digital. For the vast majority of the population though, the ability to transact in a digital form, without intermediaries or price gouging, has not occurred.

Even as users claim ownership of their previously untapped value, they still lack the ability to monetize that value through digital gateways and close the loop of direct value exchange. **Facilitating a friction-less ecosystem that empowers the users to participate in the Ownership Economy and transact in ways never seen before.**

## State of the ownership economy in 2022

![Source: Variant Fund](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*8qF0YTuSOzk4jd4l7iRosQ.png)

> Inorder to make your life easier in understanding this, I have created this infographic  :))

![Source: Own Illustration \[Gajaraj, Rohit\]](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*BCiKXa_AAnOnTux7NikGNA.png)

### What’s next? ✨

Being a creator today requires evolving from being an artist to being a founder. The job has come to encompass product management, design, community engagement, e-commerce, and data science along with being an entertainer. You have to build a team of experts and vendors to help you manage the tools to build a diversified business across platforms.

But with that diversification comes resilience. Creators become less vulnerable to shifts in priorities of the tech giants or their algorithms by owning a direct relationship with their fans. Each creator can assemble a different balance of revenue streams to match their style, no matter how niche. That’s a big win for everyone because creators catering to each of our esoteric interests can build sustainable careers. Instead of just homogeneous, lowest common denominator prime time sit-coms, we get content tuned to every sub-culture in the rainbow. Now there are finally enough creators to support a whole ecosystem of startups helping them turn their passion into their profession.

The **potential of Web3 is limitless**. With the advent of blockchain, a new era has emerged on the Internet. As such, with all of the human and financial capital inflows into the space, incredible use cases have started to gain mainstream adoption. Ownership is now extending to all kinds of products and networks.

The \*\*Ownership economy is massive and growing quickly. \*\*Many terms in addition to “the ownership economy” are used to describe how technology is empowering new ways for people to become entrepreneurs or solopreneurs. These include the passion economy, the creator economy, the empowerment economy, the freelance economy, and of course the gig economy. But no matter what you call it, it’s clear technology is creating more opportunities for people to become self-employed creators and owners.

> *‘’The new creator economy encompasses everything creators have always craved -ownership and community-led platforms where all community members are compensated for their time and contributions. Being a creator is enormously hard however we believe everyone will be a creator eventually in some capacity.’’*

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*ZkS5pAms5idBlsVFauZ6cQ.png)

## Future projections 🔮

1. Expect next-gen financial support for creators will arise. Areas around cryptocurrency, DeFi (decentralized finance), and the NFT market will continue to grow, and so will services looking to help creators.
2. Expect many more creators to embrace NFTs in their own communities as they discover how much better they can monetize by selling digital goods directly to their fans vs banner ads and other web2 monetization methods.
3. New startups are carving out specific services from both traditional and new tech incumbents ‒ transforming how content is created, produced, financed, distributed, monetized, engaged with, and owned within digital communities.
4. New web3 users who earn tokens through games and NFTs will likely choose to save those tokens in DeFi protocols vs tradfi banks given the better rates and user experience, as new token distribution designs are boosting user loyalty.
5. Expect new platforms, new partnerships, and new ways of doing things to raise customer awareness and build new and stronger customer relationships and experiences that are truly exciting.
6. The Creator Economy is also shaping the Future of Business. If you’re not creating content, you’re consuming it. In a way, you are contributing to this business trend. The only thing that is left to be seen is if or how long it will take for the creator economy to overtake the traditional economy.
7. The Ownership economy is massive and growing quickly. Expect user ownership can jumpstart; though, sustaining it is tougher. User ownership leads to richer ecosystems of projects and contributors.

```
可以通过各维度数据分析及实时的LISTING展现帮助交易者快速的抓住交易机会

# NFTFlip目标是辅助交易者在NFT短线交易中提升获利概率
```

## 交易页面功能介绍

概览：

![](https://mirror.xyz/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2Fhn2wRKNAxP5DZyFHmOFPZ.png&w=3840&q=90)

## 区域1

![](https://mirror.xyz/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2F8pRkhagwG02B3iCYTIQIV.png&w=3840&q=90)

1，搜索：可搜索721类型的合约地址，或者搜索项目名称。每次搜索结果会自动记录到搜索框内，再次点击即可出现上次搜索结果

2，提示项目部署时间，时间越短，可能被fomo的概率或量能越大

3，基础数据区，这里主要看下版税这块，显示的版税是已包含了opensea 2.5%的交易费

## 区域2

![](https://mirror.xyz/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2FFRwdRE0cVOZGF5iXRm3Hp.png&w=3840&q=90)

1，绿色呼吸提示，这代表网站数据正常流动中，如果红色，表示暂时断开，如果依然无法自动恢复，可通过刷新解决，但通常不需要手动刷新

2，快照区，点击展开显示：

![](https://mirror.xyz/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2Fsfxd24nMQrIUU6qv9M7Dj.png&w=3840&q=90)

目前提供10分钟的数据快照，可通过快照进行买卖单强弱分析，找到适合的买入点或出手点

3，数据区，这里包含：

1）全部的listing数：表示该项目当前全部的listing，鼠标指向后会提示：挂单率，是指全部listing占总项目的百分比，一般来讲，最好不要超过10%

2）降价的listing：在全部listing里，有多少是降过价的listing，降价的越多，代表卖盘欲望越强

3）10分钟listing：该数值越高，代表短时抛压越强

4）24小时售卖数据：该项目24小时内的售卖数

5）1小时售卖数：该项目1小时内售卖数，数值越高代表短期较活跃

6）10分钟售卖数：数值越高，代表短期购买越强，但也需要结合10分钟listing数据进行对比观察

7）24小时换手率：24小时售卖数据 除以 铸造量 \*100。换手率越高，可能项目价格越稳

8）地板价：当前项目实时地板价

## 区域3

![](https://mirror.xyz/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2Fy1qIztWMYG9N2F4H2zL6r.png&w=3840&q=90)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/L9BfomWeLR2D-_OgkToyk.png?height=257&width=838)

 
 这是网站核心列表，左侧listing展示项目所有最新及有效的挂单数据，右侧展示项目所有的成交数据（这里最多展示3000条）

1，listings列表：可按照 最新的时间(Data)， 地板价(Price)， 稀有度(Rank) 来进行排序，通常，可以切换到地板价(Price)排序，来观察最新价格的变动

如果该项目很火爆，在listing顶部会出现2个数据提示：一个是1分钟内 xx 挂单，这个代表出售欲望比较强烈，一个是1分钟内 xx pending 这个代表购买情绪很强烈，fomo情绪强烈，如果成交速度很快，每分钟超过10单，也会在Sales列表的上方显示1分钟的成交数据，这同样代表购买情绪比较强

2，红色三角，代表降价单，降价单代表用户想着急出售而进行降价，如果遇到降价单在listing列表上大量出现，代表可能出现了恐慌抛售，也许价格会快速下降

3,4，小钻石 和 蓝色小标识代表 该单是在 gem 或 genie 购买， gem&genie是扫单工具，可以批量购买NFT，如果在成交列表大量出现这2个小标识，代表购买欲望强烈，可能短时内会把地板价扫上去

5，筛选区域，可按照最高价格，最高rank，或tokenid进行筛选

6，如果自己买了一单后，在sales列会显示出该单的回本价格  ，放上图形标识

7，旋转的小图标代表pending， pending出现的越多代表买单力量越强

8，关于rank：如果完全开图，rank正常显示，如果项目没有完全开图，而是开了一些图，rank前面会带有叹号，并且颜色变淡，代表此时的rank因为未完全开图而不一定准确

9，点击buy弹出小狐狸，进行购买

## 区域4

![](https://mirror.xyz/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2FI2eaxRFeB8V4laDPvXCN4.png&w=3840&q=90)

这里是散点区，每个点都表示一次购买，底部是listing和sales量的对比关系，在这个区域里，可以根据listing 和sales 量的强弱来提前判断走势，例如，当sales （蓝紫色柱子）高于listing（绿色柱子）时，说明买量强，如果持续，很有可能接下来是上涨行情，如果listing明显增强并持续高于sales，很有可能价格会下降

1，某个tokenid的具体信息

2，3，可以关闭或开启sales，listing柱子的显示

4，周期筛选，这里可以调整不同周期查看走势，比如4小时，12小时，1天等，也可以在不同周期内调整时间颗粒度，比如5分钟，30分钟等。注意，此处的散点图最多可展示3000条数据，更多数据的散点图即将提供

5，去除异常：在散点图上默认是去除异常价格的token，如果关闭，会被一些高于正常水平价格的token把散点走势图拉伸，造成分析效果下降

6，左侧价位标记区：可以通过价位标识来估算压力位或支撑位，通常，整数位或包含5的位置，都可能是压力或阻力位

title: L1 BNB Chain $BNB (Binance Smart Chain)
body:
A cheat sheet to illustrate details on [Investors checklist for Blockchains](https://themoonduck-15.medium.com/investors-checklist-for-blockchain-47c14569c263) . Data or stats are not authoritative and picked from scans of tweets, discord , telegram reddit etc 2021 Q4 and some references are provided. In case of any misses do let me know and I will update. *These notes are more on under-the-hood engineering look. A separate article will cover the business development viewpoint*

*I use the trading ticker rather then name and for example for Axie Infinity blockchain game $AXS implies the coin or token and AXS implies the foundation/DAO/founders as appropriate*

**Status : DRAFT**

* Basics
* Price Action
* Stats and Links
* Highlight Pro and Con
* Technology
* Apps Ecosystem
* Funds and Promotions
* Readings

## Basics

[BNB or $BNB](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/binance-coin) is an exchange coin of Binance and centrally managed like $HT from Huobi, $CRO from [Crypto.com](http://Crypto.com) $FTX from FTT . $BNB is actively promoted by Binance with discounts on trading fees and is also the native currency on Binance Chain an early attempt to provide a low gas fee basic blockchain for its trading system followed by Smart-contract clone of Ethereum EVM Binance Smart Chain (BSC) now [renamed BNB Chain](https://en.cryptory.net/post/binance-smart-chain-renamed-to-bnb-chain/) .

BSC is supposed to be a community effort but there are little public English open groups and officials of Binance like [Samsul Karim](https://www.linkedin.com/in/samsulkarim/), Director- Business & Ecosystem Development- Binance   and [Jeff Zhang BSC  Community Manger](https://twitter.com/Tokocrypto/status/1372466437739085826?s=20) are involved . Binance chain source code is currently not open source for competitiveness reasons, according to Binance

BSC has 125 Million unique addresses and 1.2 million+ daily users and 7 Million + average daily transaction ( Dec 2021 ). It was the first chain to exceed Ethereum volume in Feb 2021 .

![https://twitter.com/BinanceChain/status/1359326372208939009](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2xsJu2EwOw3SPuC4mpri3.png?height=409&width=364)

[Nansen.ai](https://www.nansen.ai/) reported 19 Jan 2022 that BSC currently processes over 5x the number of transactions than Ethereum, and  at its peak, it processed over 10x the number of transactions,

Price Action

$BNB had parabolic growth in Q1 2021 and has not yet broken its past ATH but has given  37.095 USD (Jan 1)  - 513.677 USD (Dec 31)  in 2021 for  **1,284.75% return in 2021** with Low to High  being 17X .

![Snapshot 19 Jan 2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YLNbq1b-1OZ6E0BIUhcyR.PNG?height=318&width=842)

### Stats and Links

Community Stats:  700K+ Reddit, 1.8 Mill+ Twitter,  64K+ Telegram

[Website](https://binancex.dev/) [Explorer](https://bscscan.com/) [Twitter](https://twitter.com/binancechain) [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/binance) [Telegram](https://t.me/BinanceDEXchange) [Github](https://bit.ly/BSC_GitHub) [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/binancesmartchain) [DevDocs](https://docs.binance.org/)

### Highlights Pro and Con

* High utility of $BNB for discounts on trading on Binance and as access to list new projects ( IEO) . Rumored need to lock 3,300 $BNB
* competitive staking yield was around 14% in Q4 2021 but may come down.
* Popular apps and large user base. PancakeSwap ($CAKE)   a DEX for BSC has  2X more TVL than any other DEX on any other chain. ( see App Ecosystem section)
* Concerns on small authority based validators under Binance control ( See Bears section at end of post)
* High volume and large apps and users have seen outages on apps, numerous hacks and instability on upgrades ( More in Bears section at end of post)
* Multiple regulators have taken umbrage at Binance especially as its headquarters and jurisdiction are unclear with [‘vanishing’ Malta](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/binance) or Lithuania  location at some small time slices.
* BNB Chain rebranding includes layered Multi chain model.
* A Optimism style L2 AutoBhan Netowork

## Technology

Built on forks of [Tendermint](https://tendermint.com/) and [Cosmos SDK](https://v1.cosmos.network/sdk), the Binance Chain went live on 23 Apr 2019  with a single Binance DEX and its native token BNB migrated away from the ERC-20 Ethereum Token to a BEP-2 Binance chain token .Binance chain supports BEP-2 and BEP-8 tokens Binance launched its Smart Chain (BSC) on 1 Sep 2020 with the goal of providing an alternative,  EVM compatible smart contract-enabled blockchain and claimed 3 second Block time , 20 gwei avg fees and 16- 21 validators using POA (proof of Authority) and uses BEP-20 Tokens. Binance provides easy swap of $BNB on both chains and TrustWallet . This is the  "dual-chain architecture”.

### Consensus

BSC uses a **Delegated Proof of Stake** (DPOS) and uses a set of 16-21 validators who have to stake $BNB.  The staking status decides the top 16-21 highest staked nodes to be the next validator set, and such an election will repeat every 24 hours.

Binance uses validators on Binance Chain (BC) and syncs messages and status midnight each day between BSC and BC the *dual-chain* architecture as described in  [Binance Smart Chain Whitepaper](https://dex-bin.bnbstatic.com/static/Whitepaper_%20Binance%20Smart%20Chain.pdf)

![Source: Binance Smart Chain Whitepaper](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TLdYGtB1emNYggMNAwtpn.png?height=333&width=631)

## Apps Ecosystem

Some popular or interesting among 1,500  Dapps . [See link](https://www.coingecko.com/en/categories/binance-smart-chain). Some Tokens like Fantom $FTM and $MATIC (Polygon) BEP-20 on BSC ( $MATIC  initially launched or were funded at a Binance event) and can be bridged over.
$BUSD or Binance coin is a [stable-coin under NY state Department of Financial Services NYDFS](https://www.binance.com/en/blog/futures/busd-all-you-need-to-know-about-the-stablecoin-421499824684903051)  and has a decent volume over 3 billion+ coins traded daily in 2021

![https://twitter.com/coin98analytic/status/1355456445970599937?s=19](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zDle33-jmPqLEBqzXBCKj.jpg?height=719&width=1280)

CAKE or PanCakeSwap a AMM or DEX  and deposit and borrowing thru farms or pools. XVS Venus for lending and borrowing. AUCTION or Bounce for NFT trading. AUTO Autofarm Network  provides a DEX and yield aggregator. See [Defilama list](https://defillama.com/chain/BSC)

BSC apps have benefited from the largest CEX Binance user base and have significant value locked (TVL) as illustrated in the graphic below.

![https://twitter.com/Crypto_Dep/status/1488562216769138689?t=Sn6iOH6tNXCz1Njpm2hlQw&s=09](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rQ8Iu-MxEh3ReNBZ2SLY_.jpg?height=675&width=1200)

BSC has many NFT gaming and other apps.  See 4 infographics in this [tweet Aug 2021](https://twitter.com/Coin98Analytics/status/1429851175176732674?s=20)

## Sentiments

$BNB was issued for 15 Million ICO round in July 2017 and has had a quarterly burn till Q3 2021 estimated at 20% of Binance earning but now a  burn similar to EIP-1559 . Binance auto-burn aims to reduce 200 Million circulating coins to 100 Million .

**Promotions**

Binance heavily promoted BSC with [$100 million support fund](https://www.binance.com/en/blog/421499824684900972/Bridging-DeFi-and-CeFi-Introducing-a-$100M-Support-Fund-for-DeFi-Projects-on-Binance-Smart-Chain) to lure developers and DeFi apps from Ethereum to benefit from low fees and similar code in EVM (composability)   and invented [Binance Centralized-DeFi](https://101blockchains.com/what-is-cedefi/) or CeDeFI . Binance Labs is a very [active investor](https://messari.io/screener/binance-labs-portfolio-F98B336A) and [Binance has a Billion dollar fund](https://www.binance.org/en/1b-growth-fund) in 2021-2022 to promote crypto start-ups. Not all may be for BSC as Binance even had [investments in FTX a competitor](https://decrypt.co/76584/ftx-ceo-sam-bankman-fried-why-bought-out-binance-investment-shares-exit) and owns Coinmarketcap a infomediary provider of coins directory

**Bears**

There are fair critics of its [control by Binance  of the validators](https://twitter.com/WilsonWithiam/status/1381420702918664194) and multiple situations where withdrawals of some tokens have been suspended for some time. A quote from 1inch’s founder, Sergej Kunz:

`We don't know for sure if the BSC is centralized as we don't know who are the validators of their network. But 1inch plans to run its own validator on BSC.”`

*Source: [CoinTelegraph](https://cointelegraph.com/news/1inch-announces-expansion-to-binance-smart-chain-plans-to-run-bsc-node)*

Q3 2021 an [option to delegate](https://docs.binance.org/smart-chain/delegator/del-guide.html) your $BNB to validator and earn staking APY has been easily available esp thru TrustWallet and [validators lis](https://www.binance.org/en/staking)t  and their share and commission terms can be checked. There is a telegram bot ( @BSC_Binance_Chain_Bot )  which will send you daily earnings messages

A more telling critique is in Unchained podcast on the apparent loose Software engineering and release cycle of BSC [Is Binance Smart Chain Being Run 'Like the Project of a Stoned Teenager?' Two BSC Execs Answer - 310](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oFQjy5fyX8M)

* large % Failed transactions
* numerous hacks of apps on BSC
* There doesn't appear to be any [reasonable testing process](https://github.com/binance-chain/bsc/issues/553) in place. Every update appears to make things worse. There is no code review, patches are simply committed, in most cases even without a proper description of what they do or what problem they try to solve
* that some validators are front running without risk? does BSC have a future if Ethereum scales?

There are rumors of additional blockchains to offload NFT / Gaming and focus of BSC on DeFI.

### Readings

* [BNB Chain: The Evolving Juggernaut:  Messari](https://messari.io/article/bnb-chain-the-evolving-juggernaut)

  ```
  Further, contrary to the prevailing belief, none of the network's validators are run by Binance. Seven validators, including those run by independent third parties such as HashQuark and Certik, contribute to just under ~33% of the network's total stake. There are many fair critiques about the small validator set for the BNB Chain, but they require context. BNB Chain is not better or worse with respect to decentralization than many other blockchains. According to nakaflow.io, BNB Chain has a Nakamoto Coefficient of 7, which is in the median. With that in mind, BNB Chain can ensure greater security and network reliability by expanding the validator set with inactive validators.
  ```
* [Autobahn Network](https://medium.com/autobahnnetwork/autobahn-network-the-first-scaling-solution-for-bsc-c10c082e0bcb)

  `will open a whole new world of possibility by being the very first Layer 2 Optimistic Rollup for the BNB Smart Chain`
* [BNB Chain Roadmap 15 Feb 2022](https://www.binance.com/en/blog/ecosystem/introducing-bnb-chain-the-evolution-of-binance-smart-chain-421499824684903434)

  `Increasing throughput of BSC,Introducing on-chain governance mechanisms. Expanding the validator set of BSC from 21 to 41, with 20 validators functioning as candidate block producers. Scaling from one chain to multi-chain.Interoperability between different blockchain ecosystems`
* [The Rise of Binance - And The Effort to Reel It In - The Journal. - WSJ Podcasts](https://www.wsj.com/podcasts/the-journal/the-rise-of-binance-and-the-effort-to-reel-it-in/2e17ecf4-4ad8-49af-91b5-197653a77741)

  `It's not just the New York Stock Exchange. It is the New York Stock Exchange, the London Stock Exchange, Hong Kong, combined. No other exchange even comes close to it`.
* Unlocking Binance Cryptocurrency Exchange | [CZ CEO of Binance Interview](https://youtu.be/bxSdb7i0AAE)
* [Binance worth 300 Bill ?](https://twitter.com/JulianKlymochko/status/1459191851617898496)

  `According to the WSJ report, the estimated valuation of the company is based on the fees being generated by the exchange. For context, available data shows that the exchange processes more than $30 billion in daily spot trading and that it also processes close to $80 billion in daily derivatives trades. Other exchanges in the top 5, cumulatively, were only able to process almost half of its daily transaction volume.`

title: Tampermonkey(油猴)简明推荐教程
body:
不会有人没有听说过油猴吧？！

如果真没有，我建议你去下载体验一下，然后酌情进行使用，为什么说酌情，因为使用油猴可能会牺牲一定程度的电脑安全性，后面会跟大家简单解释，现在让我们先来了解什么是油猴。

## 什么是油猴？

油猴(Tampermonkey)是一款浏览器插件，可以理解为是一个脚本管理器，用户在GreasyFork、GitHub等平台上面把相关的脚本下载下来，即可通过油猴运行，改善我们上网等体验。

可能这么说还是不够容易理解，我再用通俗的语言说一下。

安装了油猴，你可以轻松下载各大视频网站（B站、Youtube等）的视频和音频，不用花钱买VIP即可观看到各大视频网站的VIP视频内容，随意复制各大文库禁止复制到内容，方便快捷地翻译各大英文网站等等。

功能有点强大，有了可能会上瘾，特别是那个免费观看VIP内容的（以后看海贼王就可以直接上爱奇艺了！），所以谨慎使用。

## 油猴安装教程

网上一搜一大堆，我就不详细说了，但我会简单地把流程写下来，如果还不懂怎么用的话可以私聊我。

1\.安装Chrome浏览器，需要文明上网。（没有Chrome浏览器和不会文明上网的小伙伴请自行解决，因为这是基础，当然会有其它解决办法，但是我建议一步到位吧）

2\.谷歌搜索“Tampermonkey”，点击添加至Chrome完成油猴插件安装。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/UgSOq6aGsMrE65dQQhpFi.png?height=313&width=1199)

3\.浏览器右上角点击油猴图标，点击“获取新脚本”。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/geK91ZOerhSH4lMPcr2u8.png?height=289&width=393)

4\.用户脚步标签页，点击GreasyFork网站超链接。因为GreasyFork比较容易用，当然其它的网站也能下载脚步。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/UMRNNcZY-6uRCDzbQxL2W.png?height=990&width=1049)

5\.点击脚本列表，点击总安装数，那么安装最多的脚本就会排在前面，按自己的喜好安装相关脚本即可。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/W6ZfS3EO5oPJjA3AgNm0n.png?height=473&width=1242)

## 脚本推荐

我自己也是按照总安装数来进行挑选的，有几个是我在B站看到其它博主推荐的，大家也可以在B站搜索一下，能发掘一些有用好玩的脚本进行安装下载。

我就直接上图吧，大家有兴趣的话可以直接搜索下载即可。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Yj80wUWaxTlc4X3JQNEYc.png?height=416&width=995)

其中，VIP看视频是要下载的，翻译机可以翻译Discord、Twitter上的英文内容，计时器可以无限加速在看的视频，也不用下载太多的脚本，有需要的话才下载吧。

## 安全警示

文章开头也提示风险了，油猴作为一个脚本的管理器，本身是没啥问题的，但是里面的脚本是任何人都可以制作并上传供大家使用的，没有代码基础的人，即使公开了源文件，也无法判断代码是否留有后门，用于截取用户的各种信息，包括银行账号、密码和钱包私钥等等。

所以说，一个不走运下载了恶意脚本的话，很可能会得不偿失。

但是，油猴这么强大，有时候真的不得不用，如果非得要用的话，我这里提几点建议，可能会相对提高安全系数。

1\.安装油猴插件时，使用新建的Chrome浏览器，即不要使用自己常用的那个。这样做的目的是使用一个完全新的浏览器，防止相关恶意脚本窃取钱包的密码、私钥等。（虽然实际上并不确定是否有效）

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jQeJ-tAaErbrrhP3Rag8Q.png?height=1182&width=2036)

2\.小狐狸钱包，包括其它公链钱包不要放过多的资产，这里面的关键点是：只要钱包里的钱足够少，即使黑客黑了你钱包，也完全不会心疼。

如果真有囤币需求，就好好把钱放到硬件钱包里面去吧，不然就赶紧换成RMB吧，不然容易亏完的。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PnZJTNDacn_-LlsBEpieX.png?height=540&width=708)

3\.安装脚本时，尽量装那些安装量较多、评分较高的脚本，一定程度上安全性有保障。

title: Ways of due diligence before collecting art.
body:
> ### NOTES!
>
> ***1st Note:*** *This mirror is intended to be a quick guide for what collectors can do to quick re-check artists’ legitimacy, if you are here only for that you can skip and jump right to “**DUE DILIGENCE**” section.*
>
> ***2nd note for donation/collecting the mirror:*** *Due to Mirror’s recent changes, to avoid the inconvenient collecting through Optimism net, I decided to mint my own NFT Editions on ETH mainnet (with Mirror link attached on the NFT’s description).*
>
> ***There are 3 type of NFTs with 1/1 will go through auction on Foundation.*** *You may support me through these links below and feel free to collect which one you like the most!*
>
> * **[BID 1/1 LEGENDARY!](https://foundation.app/@yun/yuniverse/5?ref=0x010d7eAfceC7589832aca1170aEb23d21951D396)** (1 ETH reserve, [bidding rewards here](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1541240896322015232?s=20&t=T8_PYGr8_18D9QVHV0OqLQ))
> * **[COLLECT RARE](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0xf01a875013d790c8f263a02b13222645fa560e68/1)** (0.1 ETH each; 25 Editions for public)
> * **[COLLECT COMMON](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0xf01a875013d790c8f263a02b13222645fa560e68/2)** (0.01 ETH each; 100 Editions for public)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LY6KHPKg9PJ6IC6AaY58U.png?height=1360&width=3000)

## INTRODUCTION

Hello frens!

A small introduction, I’m an artist that jumped into the NFT space in April 2021. People know me as [yunyuliart](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart) or you may simply call me Yun.

And I’m not alone! Meet [Caleb](https://twitter.com/EnigmaticUnreal), a very kind and humble fren I met online that does fancy dev-stuff that I don’t understand about and Caleb comes with a big brain play to keep the space safer! We will talk more about it later.

While being an artist, after a few months I’ve also slowly started collecting 1/1 NFTs on [Foundation](https://foundation.app/@yun), then slowly I keep catching one by one, some fake artists, impersonators and art thefts that attempted or even sold stolen art that was of course, not theirs. It was tiring as some of you may know I’ve been [tweeting](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1535538966425874434?s=20&t=TReIyV7VUgFcV9woGhCIgA) to expose those thieves’ wallet addresses to alert my friends & followers just simply so they won’t spend their hard-worked eth on them and keep the 1/1 community safe.

### Mission Objective

I started my journey at Foundation, I’ve been observing the platform as a user, And this is the place I started collecting 1/1. I’m familiar with it so I want to tell a little bit of the reason why I made this Mirror and why this section is about Foundation.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bw2XsK9RuxTYora2xTZK8.jpg?height=487&width=1024)

> *For the record in case you are new, Foundation was previously an exclusive curated-platform where creator needs an invitation to be able to mint and sell NFTs. Then after the invited artists got sale/bid they will get a new invitation to onboard other artists. Long story short Foundation announced on May 18, 2022, that Foundation is open to everyone without an invite.*

[https://twitter.com/foundation/status/1526963563285209089/video/1](https://twitter.com/foundation/status/1526963563285209089/video/1)

Previously, some bad actors saw the opportunity to exploit Foundation’s old curation system, an “invite” supposedly a community-curation system except they invite themselves on their alt wallets to sell a stolen art behind a new anonymous name. It was fairly easy for me to track where certain artists coming from, who invited or introduced them to Foundation, etc, all thanks to the invitation system but it’s a whole different story after Foundation’s choice of opening up the platform without any curation at all. Thus we will hardly know where certain artists are coming from, and who do we ask for their legitimacy for being the original artists or not.

Bad actors previously need the extra steps to get invited, then they need sales to generate invitations so then they can keep inviting their own alt wallet to continue their theft journey and keep repeating those efforts if one wallet got caught.

An open platform but still holding the charisma of an exclusive 1/1 platform making it a better choice for art thefts to sell stolen art with limitless possibilities and can easily hop on another wallet if one wallet got caught by me or someone else.

Although I understand Foundation’s vision that they are aiming for decentralization and pushing forward the web3 boundaries. But **it is now us genuine artists & collectors are going to need the extra steps to sell or collect art**. Honestly I don’t want collectors to need the very extra step of checking whether each artist is legit or not, and I don’t want new/veteran collectors to get scared away due to this.

So here we are, **in this mirror I will need help from all of you guys my friends to at least know what to do, to be cautious of suspicious accounts, to spread this information so all of us are safe whether you are veteran collector, new collector, or upcoming collector :)**

Lastly if people feel convenient and safe on the platform, they will keep using it and even recommending it to their friends. By prioritizing community first we will see a bright future to get mass adoption faster.

## DUE DILIGENCE

**What we are focusing on in this mirror is strictly only art theft,** in which we can objectively say the work belongs to someone else and the minter/uploader is not the original artist.

We are not going to dig into traced art, heavy referenced art, or Copyrighted fanart. Those are grey areas that I maybe will make a separate mirror if I have the chance in the future.

> ***DISCLAIMER:*** *This is all sorted from the first thing I do to the last thing I do but all according to my convenience and my style to do Due Diligence AND might not be the perfect way for someone else.*

*So, first step is..*

### 1. Reverse Image Search

This will be the first thing that comes to mind for most people on this stuff. Simply copy-paste or drag & drop the jpeg to a certain website, and it will try to search for the most similar picture according to each website.

Here are some websites you can use from best to bad *according to my experience*:

* **[SauceNao](https://saucenao.com/)** works for anime jpeg, most of the time catches from Pixiv and Twitter
* **[iqdb.org](https://iqdb.org/)** works for anime jpeg, catches from multiple website sources
* **[Yandex](https://yandex.com/)** works for general, sometimes able to catch edited or flipped images
* **[ascii2d](https://ascii2d.net/)** works for anime jpeg
* **[TinEye](https://tineye.com/)** general use
* **[Google](https://www.google.co.id/imghp)** general use

Take a note that a repost will sometimes show up too so you need to check again if the source you got is legit, a quick judge would be from the follower count is low or a seemingly like a shitposting account.

Additional fancy one is [trace.moe](https://trace.moe/) that you can use to search specific anime from a cut anime scene.

*Oh? the website above doesn’t provide any correct source and you still suspicious on the artist?
let’s continue below..*

### 2. Work Portfolio & Art Activity

Another most basic one is to check their background or history on the artist’s whole work portfolio. But I know there are people that rarely or even never posted their artwork/sketches while being legit artist. So this one is not really the answer but more of to add your conviction when an artist is established and already has a lot of works done in their portfolio. Otherwise put more investigation on the next step.

While for art activities, some artists love to post art-related stuff on their social media to keep their audience hyped.

It could be:

* **sketches/WIP**
* **drawing on livestream (example on discord, twitch)**
* **or a speedpaint**

And if you are an emerging artist reading this, I really recommend you to start doing those to gain collectors’ trust ;)

Note specifically for sketches/WIP, **be wary that sketches is the easiest one to fake.** Could be straight stolen sketch from the original artist again, or a quick traced line art from the original work, or a filter from photoshop/other similar apps. To deal with this unfortunately you need to exercise your eyes to notice the differences.

Yes it sounds tiring as these bad guys will always try to pretend and faking it. *This is why curated platform is good smh..*

> *Here are some of the sketches example from my own work. These are how my progress looks like. Different artist will also use different technique to sketch.*

![Example for one of the filter](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RUjSxHXhwBhJKn168RhEU.jpg?height=1223&width=1800&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&size=medium)

The best option for artists to convince collectors is showing the progress of the work like a video/livestream or a speedpaint if the artist uses procreate. The difference between a video/speedpaint with sketches is that on sketches you will only see a single picture of rough lines look compared to the final result, in the other hand a video/speedpaint will give you many pictures of how the shape progressed, modified, or sometimes changed completely different on some part before the final result.

For example, as I’m a photoshop user, here’s my progress from start to final on my recent work.

[https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1540356015983513601](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1540356015983513601)

### 3. On-chain/Web3 Tracking

In this method we will not be relying on the art but instead we check more of the artist’s identity and history across web3 platforms.

I used this method a lot to gather evidences when I’m exposing art theft in my tweet above if the account is very suspicious.

The steps I usually do are probably looking like this:

* Check the wallet activity on opensea (copy paste the wallet address into `opensea.io/paste-here`). This works for other platforms as well like Foundation (`foundation.app/paste-here`), SuperRare (`superrare.com/paste-here`), etc.
* Some thief tends to use the same wallet to sell/scam other stuff on opensea that is completely unrelated to supposedly their art style (a bit subjective but consider this into your suspicion).
* Check whether their opensea is not flagged/reported.

![Example of removed account due to report](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FOQx70FVUAEX0xb?format=jpg&name=medium)

Or the wallet is flagged or compromised and in the hand of a hacker.

![](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FOQx7b5UYAIsusH?format=jpg&name=small)

* Check the wallet on [etherscan](https://etherscan.io/), especially the first funding tx. (`etherscan.io/address/paste-here`)

![Fill here if you open from etherscan.io](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pmIIKzi7Y8YSRghn-U26j.png?height=269&width=879)

* Check on etherscan whether the wallet is involved with another theft/scammers’ wallet (more details in the next section).
* Check the funder’s wallet on etherscan, foundation, opensea and repeat it from the step above.

![Example of reported wallet on Foundation](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7g3JN2cB3K1cCnINDn_Az.png?height=843&width=1919)

If you catch any red flags from above, I’d suggest to avoid them first and give them time to clarify.

### 4. Etherscan Tagging (Idea from Caleb)

This is where Caleb’s idea comes in handy for me (eventually for all of us too in the future) to quick check wallets when I discover another suspicious wallet.

So here’s how it works:

* I do research on many artists
* I will provide sources with evidence if I expose any art theft (will be updated on my [art theft list tweet](https://twitter.com/yunyuliart/status/1535538966425874434?s=20&t=TReIyV7VUgFcV9woGhCIgA))
* Tag/mention Etherscan or ping Caleb and they will help put a Tag for the thefts’ wallet based on my source to be displayed as “Artist_Impersonator” on etherscan (naming might be subject to change).

![Example of tagged thief's wallet looks like on etherscan](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dFQ79VBFh6M5KYZZwO-nT.jpg?height=327&width=709)

![Example of tagged thief's wallets history on etherscan](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ef_XcvXV6wrAdf5BbiK1F.jpg?height=153&width=647)

How does this help me and the community ?

* I’m surfing etherscan a lot when doing these due diligence.
* Of course I’m checking the wallet history whether the wallet was funded by another scammer/thief wallet or not.
* Rather than remembering each thief’s wallet addresses with random numbers (0x…) and checking every wallets, seeing the tag “Artist Impersonator” straight will save my time by A LOT.
* My time saved a lot and I will do my mission faster.
* Mission done faster means Caleb can put the Tag also faster.
* The thief’s wallet tagged faster means the public will see the tag before they buy a stolen art.

If the stage above is successful, I hope people start to standardize checking certain person's wallets to see whether they got Tagged or not **BUT** also remember that if a thief didn’t get tagged that doesn’t mean they are safe, could be me being not active at the time or didn’t pass by that theft on my end. I will do my best and strive for it, that is why my mission is to make the space safer and I really believe convenience is the first step to achieve it, hence what Caleb’s idea does have really aligned with me.

Caleb also graciously helped proof-read this writing and generously gave me the permission to release this Mirror without any splitting. As a thank you, I will gift a 1/1 later and I hope we can build more amazing stuff for the community in the next chapter.

> *Now this place is out of the map, the underground will no longer about due diligence. You may leave if you want agents, cheers.*

## YOUR TURN

Congrats you have made it here!

You have read and learned all the steps above all the way down, its time for you to spread the words and gatekeep all the bad actors.

### Alert Your Friends

This time its about how you deal wisely with thieves you catch later on, *\*besides just ignoring them\**.

Before you tell your friend, before you make a tweet, before you ping your community in discord, I have tips on how to maximize convenience (*again*) when making a public alert.

* When announcing a thief web3 account with link, always put their wallet address on the link instead of username.

  `Lets put myself as an example.`
  `Dont: foundation.app/@yun`
  `Do: foundation.app/0x010d7eAfceC7589832aca1170aEb23d21951D396`

  `Dont: opensea.io/yunyuliart`
  `Do: opensea.io/0x010d7eAfceC7589832aca1170aEb23d21951D396`
* Username can be easily changed at any time, while their wallet address won't change.
* With that, your source will be reliable. Links will always be correctly linked to the thief’s account even if they change username.

## CLOSING

I think that’s all at least for now, these are all been in my mind for months. I’m happy to finally be able to voice out my concern, and I know this is not the end, the space will have a competition to cover each lacks, build on top of each other, aggregate each other or the community itself will keep improving to make the ideal place that is decentralized while still secure from art thefts.

This mirror is just the beginning, these are not perfect yet to be called a guide but it’s better to start one and hear feedback rather than waiting for each other and have no improvement towards the community.

Lastly, I apologize for my bad english and my messy writing. I still often use google translate, doubled down with writing as my least expertise in my art journey. I most of the time bad at communicating stuff and that’s part of the reason I make art through illustration.

However, I appreciated all the supports if you liked my writing or my art! Sharing it is highly appreciated as well!

Again, Thank you so much for being here with me!

title: 初识Voltz：去中心化利率互换杠杆引擎
body:
在开始了解Voltz之前，有必要先理解什么是利率，以及什么是利率互换？

## 利率和利率互换

`利率或利息率，是借款的人需要向其所借的金钱所支付的代价，亦是放款的人延迟其消费，借给借款人所获得的回报。`

简单的说，**利率是我借钱的利息和我把钱借出去的收回来的利息。**

目前来说，利率分为两种，**固定利率和浮动利率**。固定利率就是利率不会随着市场的需求而改变，浮动利率就是利率跟随市场的需求而变化。

拿AAVE来说，Dai的固定利率是11.98%，而浮动利率是2.66%。固定利率高，但不会产生大的变化，为了维持利率固定，借贷方必须要额外付出更多的“安全金”。浮动利率低，但是浮动利率会因为市场的需求而变化。

对于大型的借款来说，保持利率稳定可以减少风险，但是固定利率会付出额外的成本，这就是，利率互换存在的意义，为市场找到匹配的双方。

![AAVE的借贷利率](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V-o1Z4YEmeXGhDjl9W_tt.png?height=978&width=1349)

**利率互换**，就是固定利率和浮动利率互换。

一个例子，假设我从AAVE 使用浮动利率借贷一万美元，利率可能是2%到20%之间，那么一年利息是200刀 到 2000刀。但是，如果我使用固定利率10%，一年的利息就固定为1000刀。因为利率互换的存在，当我判断浮动利率即将上涨超过固定利率时，我就可以把我的浮动利率换成固利率，从而减少利息支出，降低成本。

目前来说，类似AAVE等借贷平台，对于每个借贷方，抵押物和利率都是一样的，但是，在传统市场里面，不同公司的贷款利息是不一样，defi目前也出现了针对不同的信用分数可以有不同的抵押率的产品。

## 使用无杠杆模式，在Voltz将浮动利率变成固定利率

在开始讲解Voltz的基本原理之前，我们先通过一个简单的例子使用Voltz完成一个操作：把浮动利率换成固定利率。

假设，我在AAVE里面存入USDC，此时，我就获得cUSDC，浮动利率为0.7%。

现在，我判断浮动利率将会下降，我就可以使用Voltz将浮动利率换成固定利率，从而锁定收益。

1. 打开Voltz的 trader-pools 中的aUSDC ，可以看到此时固定利率为1.08%。
2. 选择非杠杆交易，就是打开NO那个按钮。将我存在AAVE里面中获得的aUSDC轻松的讲浮动利率变成固定利率。

![voltz界面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Qb_HHVlZ3BMoRI0Iw5VbQ.png?height=1400&width=1184)

注意：有三个需求授权，分别FCM、ausdc、usdc。其中FCM是完全抵押模块，不同的平台，比如aave和comp的完全抵押模块是不一样的，voltz需要针对不同的池子需要适配这些平台 、aUSDC就是我们要互换的，以及一点usdc作为fee。

![成功的交易界面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1UICuoghGlxx0GsunyOYt.png?height=1400&width=1184)

成功之后，在看板界面就会看到如下信息，这样我们就成功把本来是浮动利率资产锁定为固定利率。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d_0Szv7tuB7WuQwWdxIGK.png?height=904&width=2148)

在七月31号之前，我本来是获得0.7%的利率（如果浮动利率不变的话），现在已经可以固定为1.08%的利率。

但是，这背后发生了什么呢？

## AMM 和 LP

一个比较通俗的解释：

当你想把固定利率换成浮动利率的时候，就是好像传统市场里面银行会撮合两个利率互换的双方一样，在Voltz里面，也需要撮合固定利率和浮动利率的双方达成互换的。Voltz使用AMM来做这个事情。也就是说，在上面的例子中，当我选择作为FT（**Fixed Taker）**的时候，本质来说，我是跟LP里面提供固定利率的流动性提供者做了一个兑换，LP得到了我的浮动利率仓位，而我得到了他提供的固定利率的仓位，于此同时，LP还得到一定的交易费用。

如果，后面还有一个用户，使用Voltz把固定利率换成浮动利率，利率跟现在一样，仓位也是跟我一样，他跟LP也做了一个交换，把自己的固定利率变成浮动利率，这样，本来是LP和我的互换，就变成我和后来这个人的互换，LP全身而退，并获得了一定的Fee。

但是，如果LP跟我互换之后，没有VT跟他互换，等到了结算的时候，就会变成我跟LP之间的结算。如果到时候，浮动利率涨了，LP就可以获利，反之，如果浮动利率跌了，LP就要赔钱，他从AAVE等平台获得的利息并不够支付给我的固定利率，下图演示了这一点。 
 

利率是一个波动率很低的金融产品，因此Voltz提供了杠杆引擎，每一次作为FT（固定利率接受者）或者 VT （浮动利率接受者）都可以使用杠杆，甚至LP里面也可以使用杠杆。

## 保证金引擎

为了实现最大化的利润，毕竟利率波动都很小，Voltz提供杠杆操作，最高可达一千倍。使用杠杆也非常简单，在交易界面，选中使用杠杆，输入名义金额和保证金大小，就会自动计算杠杆：

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jeQVUHS-pVExOD6Wqx7H3.png?height=1242&width=832)

这里，我是开了500刀仓位，保证金是50刀，也就是10倍的杠杆。如果到时候浮动利率涨了，那么我的亏损就会是利率差的10倍。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/O_cfHKj31jAMJfFTvEXfu.png?height=1092&width=2328)

跟普通的AMM不同，Voltz的AMM只是做价格发现，他们叫做vAMM，而资金管理则交给了保证金引擎，其实就是杠杆引擎。因此，整个Voltz协议的基本架构如下图所示：

**针对每一个利率池子，都有一个vAMM用于价格发现和促成交易，Margin Engine 则负责管理杠杆，FCM负责和其他借贷平台的接口。**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6xaS2FzVMs7vvJW73Ckw0.png?height=1783&width=2341)

以上就是我今天分享的内容，针对利率互换还有很多策略可以玩，持续探索中，最后，欢迎加入Voltz的Discord社区，里面有很多大神负责解答疑虑。

[https://discord.gg/ZWmzDmrK](https://discord.gg/ZWmzDmrK)

title: One Smpl Trick
body:
9–5 metaverses and weekend metaverses, touch grass metaverses and [touch simulation](https://www.ft.com/content/4be5677b-bc03-4e46-bbbb-68074e8dda6c) metaverses, living metaverses and dying metaverses. With a hypnotic timbre, Mark Zuckerberg tells a story about the world to come that says everything there will be just as it is here. Just as our room is now, so it will be in the world to come; where our baby sleeps now, there too it will sleep in the other world. And the clothes we wear in this world, those too we will wear there. Everything will be as it is now, just differently textured.

The familiarity of variable-poly surfaces, however, belies the novel forms of visuality that animate the metaverse. Beyond the illusory layer of avatars and environments, techniques such as subtle gaze direction exploit research on human visual cognition and attention, while computer vision algorithms are refined by data synthesized using computer graphics. For humans, these new images operate below the threshold of perception; for machines, they provide the foundation of perception. Machine learning models trained on synthetic data, which is diverse and perfectly labeled by design, generalize better than models trained on real data, enabling avatars to represent users in granular detail.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z0PeTXBZUBO9hyIKVK9T3.jpeg?height=883&width=1365&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&)

SMPLverse NFTs use facial recognition to retrieve data synthesized by Microsoft to train face tracking algorithms for its mixed reality headsets. Like many pfp projects, the Microsoft dataset uses procedural generation to randomly create and render faces without any manual intervention. The images combine a generative 3D face model with a library of artist-created assets—including textures, hair, and clothing—and SMPL, a body mesh used to animate avatars in virtual environments. Although verisimilitude is formally irrelevant to machine learning, it remains the only method of achieving functional equivalence between real and synthetic data.

Visually, the training images suggest identity play, emulating the avatars whose naturalism they are meant to enhance. Their effect, however, is to attune algorithms ever more precisely to users’ physical selves: the dataset expresses how users appear *to* virtual environments as much as how they appear *in* them. The minting process, which matches your own face to a smpl, elaborates the tension between freedom and constraint—even a pool of 100,000 images is too small to produce consistent matches.

The market-driven development of immersive technologies constitutes its own form of vision. By fractionalizing Microsoft’s dataset into NFTs, SMPLverse inverts its function, redistributing the metaverse’s centralized assets through its paradigmatic decentralized property form.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ua2pugKf_c16nk4xt8MhA.png?height=512&width=1024&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&)

### Details

* There are 511 tokens. The identity basis of the Microsoft dataset was learned from 3D scans of 511 individuals with neutral expression.
* Each token allows you to submit one image through our webcam interface. Your submitted image will be written to the token as a hash. Our facial recognition model uses this hash to match your image to a smpl.
* When the image is matched, it receives one attribute: confidence. Confidence assesses the likelihood that your image matches the smpl you receive. Confidence is a declining measure: as more smpls are matched, your likelihood of receiving a high confidence match decreases. Conversely, your likelihood of receiving a smpl with stranger visual attributes increases.
* 7 rare smpls have an additional “head pose cluster” attribute, which entitles them each to 4.14% of secondary revenue. These rare smpls form a group of images clustered by head pose. As more rare smpls are matched, the bounds of the cluster will sharpen. To acquire a rare smpl, token holders must recognize the same patterns that a facial recognition system trained on the dataset would be optimized to recognize.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qWWsezFM2rbJ0wyPkWdJQ.jpg?height=288&width=249&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&)

SMPLverse is launching June 24, 2022 at [smplverse.xyz](https://smplverse.xyz/) at 9am PDT / 12pm EDT / 6pm CEST. Please check the site for your local timezone.

Find more details on our [Twitter](https://twitter.com/smplverse) and our [Discord](https://discord.gg/2hWDykfUdq).

在原来的 OKEx 账户设计中，BTC/USDT 永续合约与BTC/USDT 交割合约、ETH/USDT 永续合约都是不互通的，各账户之间的资金余额和仓位收益不能共享，占用了较多资金。

但在统一账户下，单币种保证金模式支持相同结算币种的衍生品之间共用保证金，跨币种保证金模式则是将不同币种资产统一折合成美元价值，实现不同结算币种的所有衍生品之间共享保证金，由此减少了资金占用，提高了资金的利用效率，用户可以用这些资金来撬动更大收益。

![](https://assets.matters.news/embed/3e6938e6-c01e-4459-aad8-2cac8c92c215.png)

 
 

3、降低爆仓风险，主动降杠杆

保证金和收益的共享，降低了用户爆仓风险。特别是经常夜间出现「插针」行情，保证金共享可以减少插针爆仓的情况。

在跨币种保证金模式下，假设我现在账户有 1 个 BTC，10 个 ETH，购买了 BTC 永续合约；由于 BTC 价格波动剧烈BTC 仓位即将爆仓时，此时 10 个 ETH 将起到保证金的作用。

反过来看，全仓模式下保证金可以共享，若操作不慎，资金有可能爆仓归零。这也让用户更加谨慎，从而让主动降低杠杆倍数，避免强平。

当然，也有不少用户是高风险偏好者，喜欢用 100 USDT等少量资金加上高杆杆，以小搏大。统一账户也同时设有逐仓模式，小仓位爆仓不会影响其余资金安全，隔离风险。

4、自动借币功能

假设我拥有 1000 个 OKB 作为保证金（单价 20 美元） ，想要做多购买 1 ETH（单价 1800 美元），但 OKEx 并没有 ETH/OKB 合约交易对。通常需要进行两次交易，用 OKB 换成 USDT，再换成 ETH；但在统一账户中，可以直接选择 ETH/USDT 交易对进行购买，并产生 1800 USDT的负债。在跨币种全仓模式下，合约产生了的未实现盈亏会享有一个免息额度，不仅不需要支付利息，还省下了手续费。

反过来看，全仓模式下保证金可以共享，若操作不慎，资金有可能爆仓归零。这也让用户更加谨慎，从而让主动降低杠杆倍数，避免强平。

当然，也有不少用户是高风险偏好者，喜欢用 100 USDT等少量资金加上高杆杆，以小搏大。统一账户也同时设有逐仓模式，小仓位爆仓不会影响其余资金安全，隔离风险。

4、自动借币功能

假设我拥有 1000 个 OKB 作为保证金（单价 20 美元） ，想要做多购买 1 ETH（单价 1800 美元），但 OKEx 并没有 ETH/OKB 合约交易对。通常需要进行两次交易，用 OKB 换成 USDT，再换成 ETH；但在统一账户中，可以直接选择 ETH/USDT 交易对进行购买，并产生 1800 USDT的负债。在跨币种全仓模式下，合约产生了的未实现盈亏会享有一个免息额度，不仅不需要支付利息，还省下了手续费。

title: 'PhantaBear'NFT项目分析报告
body:
## AvatarDAO-WEB3.0首个无GP的创投共同体

![AVATAR DAO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pEray8PMkFV0ZVbY4YC-Q.png?height=768&width=1400)

## AvatarDAO介绍：

AvatarDAO是首个无GP的创投共同体，100％由DAO社区拥有、治理和驱动。AVATARDAO由加密OG、创业者、投资家、独立研究员和Web3爱好者发起组成，旨在打造无边界、更多人受益的Web3投资协作引擎。

## AvatarDAO运行机制：

我们的**创投共同体**形成一个DAO（去中心化的自治组织），一个数字的创投场所，行业领导者们聚集在一起，帮助更多的行业建设者成长，并形成一种新的合作与投资方式。在这个共同体中，任何人都能参与进来这个社会实验，并贡献自己所长。

# Avatar的含义：

AVATAR的本意是头像或分身，以及——一颗星球。对我们来说AVATAR更有着元宇宙的寓意，同时也能联想到星际以及对未来世界的探索。我们希望因DAO的共识凝聚成的共同体，有着共建创投的愿景和独特的文化。

## 如何加入AvatarDAO：

* 如果你对Web3和DAO充满热忱，希望凭自己一技之长回馈社区，成为AVATARDAO公会贡献者的[申请入口](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLmpVbt0m4ugGRUh1YNv4NFTcz5YxVCUeDQgqFkNyWuYSKWw/viewform)
* 如果你是行业OG和独立研究员，希望在擅长的赛道领域用专业知识引领更多伙伴前行，成为[赛道导师/顾问的申请入口](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLmpVbt0m4ugGRUh1YNv4NFTcz5YxVCUeDQgqFkNyWuYSKWw/viewform?usp=pp_url)
* 如果你已经是或者希望成为投资经理，希望验证自身想法或提升自我的[申请入口](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLmpVbt0m4ugGRUh1YNv4NFTcz5YxVCUeDQgqFkNyWuYSKWw/viewform?usp=pp_url)
* 第一批LP已经满额，第二批LP的官网申请链接 [https://www.avatardao.m](https://www.avatardao.me/Proposal)

![以上为出品方介绍，以下为文章正文](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yy-9ufK3w0jfXW7batCvb.png?height=43&width=868)

## 文章目录：

1. **项目基础信息：1.1 NFT基础信息；1.2 核心成员介绍；1.3 NFT艺术设计分析**
2. **项目发展规划：2.1 RoadMap分析；2.2 NFT赋能分析；2.3 合作伙伴介绍**
3. **项目团队运营：3.1 推特信息分析；3.2 社区氛围分析**
4. **市场数据分析：4.1 链上数据分析**
5. **文章总结**

##  

> ##     项目基础信息

## 1.1 NFT基础信息

NFT发行数量：**10k**

Mint价格：**0.26** ETH

NFT Token Standard：**ERC-721**

NFT发行日期：**2022.01.01**

Traits数量：**142** 种

**Phanta** **Bear** 的中文直译名为‘幻影熊’，但在各大中文NFT社区或交流社群中，玩家们更喜欢叫它 ‘**杰伦熊**’，只因 **Phanta** **Bear** NFT系列与华语流行歌曲天王 ‘周杰伦’ 关系密切，发行之初更是得到了周杰伦在个人Instagram上的公开背书，顶级巨星光环的加持下，**Phanta** **Bear** 一时风头无两。

虽然 **Phanta Bear** 有周董的个人背书，但 **Phanta Bear NFT** 其实与周董本人的关系比较微妙，周杰伦创立的杰威尔音乐有限公司曾在微博发布声明称，周杰伦并未参与 **Phanta Bear NFT** 有关于商业行为的任何策划经营，也从未其中取得任何收益。不过 **Phanta Bear** 发行不久，周杰伦便将个人社交媒体头像换成了该NFT形象，并附文“2022哥先换几个月的头像，感受一下元宇宙的感觉”，同时也强调这其实是”哥收到的第一个特别礼物“，既表达了对好友的感谢，同时也暗示了一些私底下的商业合作关系。

**Phanta Bear** 发行于2022年1月1日，它由10k个以太坊链上随机组合生成的半身熊形象集合而成，每个NFT的动作、服装、饰品设计之间各不相同，但又有着相同的主题：潮流与时尚。

**Phanta Bear** 的官方Mint价格为0.26 ETH。该NFT项目由周杰伦与其好友在2006年创立的潮流品牌 [PHANTACi](https://twitter.com/PHANTACi_06) 与去中心化娱乐平台 [Ezek](https://twitter.com/ezekclub) 共同创建，后者的的母公司 Starvision Entertainment Ltd．（S.E.L）则是由周杰伦好友 ‘刘畊宏’ 和 ‘耿展’ 创办。

![杰威尔音乐官方微博的声明](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wVnQg6eyHgqJVbw90IRSf.jpg?height=1321&width=1170)

![周董个人Instagram](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/71vM6o4Cp2hZcBW9ljKu9.jpg?height=1807&width=1170)

## 1.2 核心成员介绍

正如我们在1.1部分所提到的， Phanta Bear NFT 的背后资方关系网络较为复杂，目前较为官方说法的Co-Founder有两位：**WILL L** 和 **MARK G**。

* **WILL L** （刘畊宏）

刘畊宏，1972年10月7日出生于台湾省高雄市，中国台湾男歌手、创作人、主持人和演员，与周杰伦是中学时期就认识的同窗好友加铁杆死党，时至今日两人依旧保持着亲密的朋友关系。2007年10月7日，刘畊宏与妻子王婉霏在台北完婚时，周董更是担任伴郎一职，亲自现身为好友庆祝终身大事。

除了生活上的密切交集，刘畊宏与周杰伦同时也是演员道路上的亲密伙伴，2005年，二人曾共同出演动作电影《头文字D》，分别担任‘藤原拓海’和‘岩城清次’两位经典角色。刘、周二人的关系之密切，由此可见一斑。

* **MARK G（**耿展**）**

与周杰伦、刘畊宏不同，耿展并不是混迹演艺圈的明星，因此在网络上的报道与曝光量也会稍微少一些。从EZEK的官网介绍中我们可以得知：耿展从小就对电影产生了浓厚的兴趣，高中毕业之后就去到”浪漫之都“法国巴黎学习电影制片多年，回国后耿展创建了电影制片公司”星异象“，并结识了同为电影制片人的刘畊宏，两者达成了非常紧密的商业伙伴关系。耿展曾与一位好莱坞传奇明星一起周游世界，将中国传统文化传播到了中东与欧美多个地区，现在他想把他所有的娱乐体验带到区块链这一全新的领域。

![ Phanta Bear NFT 的 Co-Founder](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QfZBzhcHeYo88RcdshSxQ.jpg?height=3019&width=4032)

## 1.3 NFT艺术设计分析

**Phanta** **Bear** 作为一款2D PFP NFT，以一只佩戴着星星眼墨镜，左手举起、右手放下的半身小熊为主要人物形象，搭配上中西方混合的Traits设计，能够为 **Phanta** **Bear** 带来更多市场可能性。

你可以在 **Phanta** **Bear** 的Traits设计中看到中国的唐装，也可以看到西方寓言中的吸血鬼伯爵装，可爱的小熊里既有穿着西服的商业成功人士，也有穿着球服、戴着嘻哈项链的街头篮球爱好者。142种Traits设计属于行业中高等水平，能够满足大多数NFT爱好者基于自身实际情况而来的挑选需求。

![Phanta Bear RANK1-9展示](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z70h_gEsEVFJU3kf83XrS.jpg?height=4027&width=4032)

> ##     项目发展规划

## 2.1 RoadMap分析

以下为 **Phanta** **Bear 2.0** 中所提到的内容：

1\.**社区**及社区钱包建立 

2\.质押**积分**系统（积分可使用于各个福利及线上、线下场景） 

3\.**Phanta Bear** 结合 **Phancy Pets** 的释出，解锁更多 Phanta Pass权益 

4\.Members-onliy 

  4-1.持续输出的**实体产品**打造（服饰、公仔、包等） 

  4-2.专属**线上商城**可兑换和购买会员专属产品 

  4-3.解锁更多合作伙伴的**虚拟地产**、房产，及**元宇宙**社区场景的搭建 

  4-4.享有PHANTACI与各大知名品牌合作系列产品的**空投**及**抽奖** 

  4-5.社区各类线上、线下**熊友聚会** 

  4-6.与艺人明星**互动**机会 

5\.**元宇宙虚拟演唱会**

从以上内容我们其实能够看出， **Phanta** **Bear** 的发展重心是放在社区的价值回馈和线下实体福利上的。**Phanta** **Bear** 希望通过自身的努力和周董超强的粉丝凝聚力，打造一个共识极其坚实的NFT社群，最终塑造一个覆盖亚洲乃至全世界的潮流IP品牌。

![PhantaBear RoadMap 2.0](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8AfcXSzpxCzEJT1czxZCe.png?height=1754&width=1241)

![PhantaBear 2022全年计划](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VMZ6JTTgNtzdlPEaj-njG.png?height=1379&width=3341&size=medium)

## 2.2 NFT赋能分析

一款NFT的具体赋能，一直是社群所关心的重点，而 **Phanta** **Bear** 的具体赋能其实在 **2.1RoadMap** 中的【**Members-onliy**】中有所提到，类似于持有者们可以通过积分系统在线上商店中兑换自己想要的实体福利，类似于玩具公仔和 **Phanta** **Bear** 主题的潮流服饰，亦或者是通过 **Phanta** **Bear** 与其他蓝筹NFT社区的合作，为持有者提供NFT白名单。

值得一提的是，**Phanta** **Bear** 社区已经在五月中旬通过Discord社区内部抽奖的方式，送出了一只由周董亲笔签名的黄金全身熊熊公仔，此公仔为【全球唯一签名版黄金熊】，收藏价值与纪念价值极高。

![PhantaBear 周董亲笔签名黄金熊福利抽奖](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_2BtYYAbI5XxS_ZdLuP59.png?height=917&width=688)

除了上面所提到的内容之外，**Phanta** **Bear** 社区还将为持有者提供专属的演唱会Vip通道，虽然目前由于全球疫情的影响，很多地区无法开展演唱会，但是在疫情得到有效控制的将来， **Phanta** **Bear** 的持有者应该能享受到专属的线下福利，或许能在后台与自己的偶像来个亲密接触也不一定呢？ **Phanta** **Bear** 还将建立社区钱包，将收益的一部分所得纳入到社区金库中，通过投票提案的方式来决定钱包的使用方向。

## 2.3 合作伙伴介绍

![Matrix Labs map](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iXU5BOV2zWPjj46NBPHLB.png?height=889&width=1908&size=medium)

**[Matrix](https://matrixworld.org/home)**[ ](https://matrixworld.org/home)**[Labs](https://matrixworld.org/home)** 是 **Ezek** 的技术合作伙伴，Matrix Labs 由一群经验丰富、技术老练的区块链开发人员组成。他们与 Ezek 合作，将 **Phanta Bear** 带到区块链的世界中。

Matrix Labs 同时也是 Matrix World 背后的创造者，这是一个充满无限可能的新时代元宇宙项目。在 Matrix World 中，用户可以用一种全新的方式创建、连接、探索和游戏，也可以通过出售他们的作品来获得收益。

> ##     项目团队运营

## 3.1 推特信息分析

![@PhantaBearClub 信息分析](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aQvP3F3JxoxafUX39uTBO.png?height=332&width=1137&size=medium)

![@PhantaBearClub 推文类型分析 ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VTjpIhrzpvZZ2RMtHzkLI.png?height=330&width=567)

![@EzekClub 信息分析](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mKPoNJ1m22PxyLclcKgvo.png?height=334&width=1136&size=medium)

![@EzekClub 推文类型分析](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eglMD6Llp9LLAXplZGlOV.png?height=330&width=565)

由 [accountanalysis](https://accountanalysis.app/) 所提供的数据我们可知，作为 **Phanta** **Bear** 项目官推的[@PhantaBearClub](https://twitter.com/PhantaBearClub) 发推频率与发推数量要明显少于作为出品方的 [@EzekClub](https://twitter.com/EzekClub) 。且 **Phanta** **Bear** 项目官推的[@PhantaBearClub](https://twitter.com/PhantaBearClub) 自4月19日起正式启用，截止至2022年7月2日，粉丝数目为36K，总推特数为99条，发推的时间并不算频繁，并且在发布内容上也多以广告、项目合作为主，或许在未来可以多进行一些与粉丝群体的互动，从而提高整体社群的积极性。

## 3.2 社区氛围分析

截止到2022年7月2日，**Phanta** **Bear** 的Discord总人数约为33k人，在线人数约为3k人，大概占比10%，主要聊天区较为活跃，基本每天都有人在中英文大厅聊天，聊天内容涉及到多个内容，持有者们是以一种轻松愉快的氛围在进行交流。除Discord外，**Phanta** **Bear** 的微信聊天群也很火爆，人员已经达到500人的满员状态，每天的消息也很繁多热闹。

除此之外，Discord社群内部经常举办各类音乐活动，参与人数基本稳定在150人左右。下图就是名为”\[夏日狂想\] x S7NS STATION“的 **Phanta** **Bear** 主题音乐会，气氛非常活跃欢快。

![PhantaBear 主题音乐会：\[夏季狂想\] x S7NS STATION ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c966f-7NJFE12M6AGp-CB.png?height=961&width=1526&size=medium)

除了线上的聚会、活动之外，**Phanta** **Bear** 的线下聚会也非常热闹，下图是 **Phanta** **Bear** 北京社群的线下聚餐活动，单看照片都觉得非常地具有人情魅力。

![PhantaBear 北京社群聚会](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_A9SIDHOns98v8cekpUvt.png?height=1791&width=1440)

图片来源于 **Phanta** **Bear** 的Discord社群，由于涉及到隐私安全问题，故已将所有参与者进行遮挡处理。

![PhantaBear 北京社群聚会](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RlPIX1bIKC39VixZlxNYp.png?height=3024&width=4032)

> ##     项目基础信息

## 4.1 链上数据分析

![PhantaBear NFTGO 基本信息](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WkPP7G9T94YENH1p_XKww.png?height=378&width=1519&size=medium)

截止到2022年7月2日，**PhantaBear** 持有者总数为 **5131** 人，NFT人均占比约为 **1.95**；总市值约为$**53,632,279**，市场排名为第 **42** 位；24H交易额约为 $**12,556.4**，市场排名为第 **129** 位。

![市值&交易额](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TfbHPsdoR918E-V3zCG7J.png?height=489&width=1473&size=medium)

![交易价格变动](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Lw8V1zHK69-371jsgILwU.png?height=611&width=1479&size=medium)

由市值与地板价格变动来看，**PhantaBear** 的表现在经历发售初期的火爆之后，便一直处于缓慢下行趋势。从整体价格反应曲线来看，**PhantaBear** 的价格始终处于一种缩量下跌的状态，量能不断降低的同时，价格也在下跌，导致这种情况发生的原因有可能是持有者信心不足，不停低价抛售从而引起持续性的恐慌，当然其中也有受整体NFT市场市值不断萎缩所导致的影响。

![蓝筹潜力数据](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vHyzyRqtQ5JWLbWorQtmt.png?height=210&width=1475&size=medium)

![各类持有者数量变化](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/idHGTkKRUaVHYYkv6G-p-.png?height=502&width=1479&size=medium)

**PhantaBear** 的蓝筹项目持有人数量为 **993** 人，约占总持有人的 **19.35%**，总持有NFT数量为 **2054** 个，约占总NFT数量的 **20.54%**；巨鲸数量为 **37** 人，约占总持有人的 **0.72%**，总持有NFT数量为 **228** 个，约占总NFT数量的 **2.28%**。

由上我们可以看出，蓝筹项目持有者的数量并没有太大变化，其对待 **PhantaBear** 的态度为“**长期持有**”；同时，NFT巨鲸玩家的数量处于缓慢上行状态，其对待 **PhantaBear** 的态度同样为“**长期持有**”。

![持有数量分布&持有时长分布](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ttJHiTj-U9Tg6-LM0J0GR.png?height=526&width=1523&size=medium)

如今 OKEx 统一账户，支持在一个账户下进行各类型交易，不再需要在多个账户之间进行资金划转，降低了用户的操作复杂度。

特别是随着市场进入牛市，越来越多的新用户进入市场，即便没做过交易的人，也能一眼看懂统一账户。这就降低了使用门槛和学习成本，更加有利于加密交易的“出圈”。

2、提高资金利用率

在原来的 OKEx 账户设计中，BTC/USDT 永续合约与BTC/USDT 交割合约、ETH/USDT 永续合约都是不互通的，各账户之间的资金余额和仓位收益不能共享，占用了较多资金。

但在统一账户下，单币种保证金模式支持相同结算币种的衍生品之间共用保证金，跨币种保证金模式则是将不同币种资产统一折合成美元价值，实现不同结算币种的所有衍生品之间共享保证金，由此减少了资金占用，提高了资金的利用效率，用户可以用这些资金来撬动更大收益。

![](https://assets.matters.news/embed/3e6938e6-c01e-4459-aad8-2cac8c92c215.png)

保证金和收益的共享，降低了用户爆仓风险。特别是经常夜间出现「插针」行情，保证金共享可以减少插针爆仓的情况。

当然，也有不少用户是高风险偏好者，喜欢用 100 USDT等少量资金加上高杆杆，以小搏大。统一账户也同时设有逐仓模式，小仓位爆仓不会影响其余资金安全，隔离风险。
